Sanction Details:

JPMS NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE FINDINGS OF FACT AND
CONCLUSIONS OF LAW CONTAINED IN THE CONSENT ORDER ("ORDER"),
AND CONSENTS TO THE ENTRY OF THE ORDER BY THE DFI. JPMS
ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DFI A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $52,200.00,
WHICH WAS REMITTED ON OR ABOUT OCTOBER 10, 2014.

Firm Statement

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY JPMS WITH A
MULTISTATE TASK FORCE COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF NASAA. AS PART
OF THE GLOBAL SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER CONSENT
ORDERS, IN WHICH JPMS NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE
ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, THE DFI ALLEGED THAT THE
ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN WISCONSIN THROUGH SALES
ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN WISCONSIN AND IN
CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND
RECORDS PERTAINING TO THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO
ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS VIOLATED WIS.STATS. § 551.402(4) AND §
4.03 OF THE CODE, WHICH CONSTITUTED GROUNDS TO
IMPOSE SANCTIONS/DISCIPLINE PURSUANT TO WIS.STATS. §§ 551.412 AND
551.412(4)(I) AND § 4.05(2)OF THE CODE. WITHOUT ADMITTING OR
DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, JPMS AGREED TO MAKE, ANDALREADY HAS
MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS REGISTRATION POLICIES,
PROCEDURES AND OTHER PROCESSES. JPMS ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE
DFI A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $52,200.00, WISCONSIN'S ALLOCATED
PORTION OF THE AMOUNT AGREED TO WITH NASAA. FINALLY, THE DFI
AND
JPMS AGREED THAT THE ORDER WOULD NOT SUBJECT JPMS TO ANY
DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS, ANY STATE, THE
DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR
UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY SECURITIES OR
COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR
SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATION, WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE
AGREEMENT WITH NASAA.

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE

MORGAN SECURITIES LLC ("JPMS")
ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE
NOT REGISTERED IN KENTUCKY IN
VIOLATION OF THE SECURITIES ACT OF KENTUCKY ("KRS") §§ 292.330(1)
AND 292.330(7); JPMS FAILED
TO MONITOR THE REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS
AND ENFORCE ITS SUPERVISORY
PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THESE PERSONS WERE REGISTERED IN
KENTUCKY IN VIOLATION OF KRS §
292.337(2)(K) AND THE KENTUCKY ADMINISTRATIVE REGULATIONS ("KAR")
808 KAR 10:030, § 4, WHICH CONSTITUTED GROUNDS TO IMPOSE
SANCTIONS PURSUANT TO KRS § 292.500(14); AND JPMS FAILED TO
RECORD THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT
ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF KRS §§ 292.336(1)(C) AND 292.336(2)(B).

User Guidance

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY JPMS WITH A
MULTISTATE TASK FORCE COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF NASAA. AS PART
OF THE GLOBAL SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER CONSENT
ORDERS, IN WHICH JPMS NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE
ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, THE DFI ALLEGED THAT THE
ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN KENTUCKY THROUGH SALES
ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN KENTUCKY AND IN CERTAIN
INSTANCES, THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND
RECORDS PERTAINING TO THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO
ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS VIOLATED KRS §§ 292.330(1), 292.330(7),
292.337(2)(K), 292.336(1)(C), AND 292.336(2)(B), AND 808 KAR 10:030, § 4,
WHICH CONSTITUTED GROUNDS TO IMPOSE SANCTIONS PURSUANT TO
KRS §
292.500(14). WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, JPMS
AGREED TO MAKE, AND ALREADY HAS MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL
CHANGES TO ITS REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER
PROCESSES. JPMS ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DFI A SUM IN THE AMOUNT
OF $50,800.00, KENTUCKY'S ALLOCATED PORTION OF THE AMOUNT
AGREED TO WITH NASAA. FINALLY, THE DFI AND JPMS AGREED THAT THE
ORDER WOULD NOT SUBJECT JPMS TO ANY DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER
THE FEDERAL LAWS, ANY STATE, THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO
RICO, OR THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR UNDER THE RULES OR
REGULATIONS OF ANY SECURITIES OR COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR
SELF-REGULATORY
ORGANIZATION, WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE AGREEMENT WITH
NASAA.

Disclosure 87 of 331
Reporting Source:

Regulator

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

SEC ADMIN RELEASE 34-73502 / NOVEMBER 3, 2014: THE SECURITIES AND
EXCHANGE COMMISSION DEEMS IT APPROPRIATE AND IN THE PUBLIC
INTEREST THAT PUBLIC ADMINISTRATIVE AND CEASE-AND-DESIST
PROCEEDINGS BE, AND HEREBY ARE, INSTITUTED PURSUANT TO
SECTIONS 15(B), 15B(C)(2) AND 21C OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT
OF 1934 AGAINST J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC ("J.P. MORGAN" OR
"RESPONDENT"). IN ANTICIPATION OF THE INSTITUTION OF THESE
PROCEEDINGS, RESPONDENT HAS SUBMITTED AN OFFER OF
SETTLEMENT (THE "OFFER") WHICH THE COMMISSION HAS DETERMINED
TO ACCEPT. SOLELY FOR THE PURPOSE OF THESE PROCEEDINGS AND
ANY OTHER PROCEEDINGS BROUGHT BY OR ON BEHALF OF THE
COMMISSION, OR TO WHICH THE COMMISSION IS A PARTY, AND WITHOUT
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC
ADMITTING OR DENYING THE FINDINGS HEREIN, EXCEPT AS TO THE

254

"RESPONDENT"). IN ANTICIPATION OF THE INSTITUTION OF THESE
PROCEEDINGS, RESPONDENT HAS SUBMITTED AN OFFER OF
SETTLEMENT (THE "OFFER") WHICH THE COMMISSION HAS DETERMINED
TO ACCEPT. SOLELY FOR THE PURPOSE OF THESE PROCEEDINGS AND
ANY OTHER PROCEEDINGS BROUGHT BY OR ON BEHALF OF THE
COMMISSION, OR TO WHICH THE COMMISSION IS A PARTY, AND WITHOUT
ADMITTING OR DENYING THE FINDINGS HEREIN, EXCEPT AS TO THE
COMMISSION'S JURISDICTION OVER IT AND THE SUBJECT MATTER OF
THESE PROCEEDINGS, WHICH ARE ADMITTED, RESPONDENT CONSENTS
TO THE ENTRY OF THIS ORDER INSTITUTING ADMINISTRATIVE AND
CEASE-AND-DESIST PROCEEDINGS PURSUANT TO SECTIONS 15(B),
15B(C)(2) AND 21C OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934, MAKING
FINDINGS, AND IMPOSING REMEDIAL SANCTIONS AND A CEASE-ANDDESIST ORDER. ON THE BASIS OF THIS ORDER AND RESPONDENT'S
OFFER, THE COMMISSION FINDS THAT: THESE PROCEEDINGS INVOLVE
THE SALE OF NON-INVESTMENT GRADE OR "JUNK" BONDS ISSUED BY THE
COMMONWEALTH OF PUERTO RICO ("PUERTO RICO") BY J.P. MORGAN, A
REGISTERED BROKER-DEALER AND MUNICIPAL SECURITIES DEALER, TO A
CUSTOMER IN AN AMOUNT BELOW THE MINIMUM DENOMINATION OF THE
ISSUE. RULE G-15(F) PROMULGATED BY THE MUNICIPAL SECURITIES
RULEMAKING BOARD ("MSRB") PROHIBITS DEALERS FROM EFFECTING
CUSTOMER TRANSACTIONS IN MUNICIPAL SECURITIES IN AMOUNTS
BELOW THE MINIMUM DENOMINATIONS OF THE ISSUES. MINIMUM
DENOMINATIONS ARE GENERALLY INTENDED TO LIMIT SALES OF
MUNICIPAL SECURITIES TO RETAIL INVESTORS FOR WHOM SUCH BONDS
MAY NOT BE SUITABLE, BUT THE PROSCRIPTIONS OF RULE G-15(F) APPLY
TO ALL TRANSACTIONS WITH CUSTOMERS, REGARDLESS OF WHETHER
THE SECURITIES ARE SUITABLE FOR THE CUSTOMER. IN MARCH 2014, J.P.
MORGAN VIOLATED MSRB RULE G-15(F) BY EXECUTING ONE UNSOLICITED
SALES TRANSACTION IN THE PUERTO RICO BONDS WITH A CUSTOMER IN
AN AMOUNT BELOW THE $100,000 MINIMUM DENOMINATION OF THE ISSUE
ESTABLISHED BY THE ISSUER, PUERTO RICO, AND SPECIFIED IN THE
OFFICIAL STATEMENT. THE LIMITED EXCEPTIONS PROVIDED UNDER MSRB
RULE G-15(F) FOR CUSTOMER TRANSACTIONS IN MUNICIPAL SECURITIES
BELOW THE MINIMUM DENOMINATION OF AN ISSUE DID NOT APPLY TO
THIS TRANSACTION. RESPONDENT INFORMED THE CUSTOMER OF THE
RISKS OF TRADING IN THE 2014 BONDS BEFORE EXECUTING THE TRADE.
AS A RESULT OF THE CONDUCT, RESPONDENT WILLFULLY VIOLATED
MSRB RULE G-15(F). AS A RESULT OF RESPONDENT'S WILLFUL
VIOLATIONS OF MSRB RULE G-15(F), RESPONDENT WILLFULLY VIOLATED
SECTION 15B(C)(1) OF THE EXCHANGE ACT.

www.finra.org/brokercheck

UNITED STATES SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION

Cease and Desist/Injunction

Other Sanctions Ordered:
Sanction Details:

ACCORDINGLY, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT: RESPONDENT CEASE AND
DESIST FROM COMMITTING OR CAUSING ANY VIOLATIONS AND ANY
FUTURE VIOLATIONS OF SECTION 15B(C)(1) OF THE EXCHANGE ACT AND
MSRB RULE G-15(F). RESPONDENT IS CENSURED. RESPONDENT SHALL,
WITHIN SEVEN (7) DAYS OF THE ENTRY OF THIS ORDER, PAY A CIVIL
MONEY PENALTY IN THE AMOUNT OF $54,000. RESPONDENT WILLFULLY
VIOLATED MSRB RULE G-15(F). AS A RESULT OF RESPONDENT'S WILLFUL
VIOLATIONS OF MSRB RULE G-15(F), RESPONDENT WILLFULLY VIOLATED
SECTION 15B(C)(1) OF THE EXCHANGE ACT.

Regulator Statement

IN DETERMINING TO ACCEPT THE OFFER, THE COMMISSION CONSIDERED
REMEDIAL ACTS PROMPTLY UNDERTAKEN BY RESPONDENT. AFTER IT
WAS MADE AWARE BY COMMISSION STAFF THAT IT HAD EFFECTED A
CUSTOMER TRANSACTION IN THE 2014 BONDS BELOW THE MINIMUM
DENOMINATION OF THE ISSUE, RESPONDENT CANCELLED THE
TRANSACTION PRIOR TO SETTLEMENT. FOLLOWING THE TRANSACTION,
RESPONDENT CONDUCTED ADDITIONAL TRAINING REGARDING
COMPLIANCE WITH MSRB RULE G-15(F). RESPONDENT WILL UNDERTAKE
TO REVIEW THE ADEQUACY OF ITS EXISTING POLICIES AND PROCEDURES
RELATING TO COMPLIANCE WITH MSRB RULE G-15(F). AFTER THAT
REVIEW, RESPONDENT WILL MAKE SUCH CHANGES AS ARE NECESSARY
TO EFFECT COMPLIANCE WITH MSRB RULE G-15(F), INCLUDING ADOPTING
NEW POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OR SUPPLEMENTING EXISTING
POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. RESPONDENT WILL IMPLEMENT THESE
POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, AND CONDUCT TRAINING AS TO THE
POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AND COMPLIANCE WITH MSRB RULE G-15(F).
RESPONDENT WILL INFORM COMMISSION STAFF NO LATER THAN SIX (6)
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC
MONTHS AFTER THE ENTRY OF THIS ORDER THAT IT HAS COMPLIED WITH

256

www.finra.org/brokercheck

TO EFFECT COMPLIANCE WITH MSRB RULE G-15(F), INCLUDING ADOPTING
NEW POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OR SUPPLEMENTING EXISTING
POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. RESPONDENT WILL IMPLEMENT THESE
POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, AND CONDUCT TRAINING AS TO THE
POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AND COMPLIANCE WITH MSRB RULE G-15(F).
RESPONDENT WILL INFORM COMMISSION STAFF NO LATER THAN SIX (6)
MONTHS AFTER THE ENTRY OF THIS ORDER THAT IT HAS COMPLIED WITH
THE ABOVE UNDERTAKINGS.

Final

Allegations:

ON NOVEMBER 3, 2014, JPMORGAN SECURITIES LLC ("JPMS") ENTERED
INTO A SETTLEMENT WITH THE SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION
("SEC") RESULTING IN THE SEC ISSUING AN ORDER. JPMS CONSENTED
TO THE ENTRY OF THE ORDER THAT FINDS THAT JPMS WILLFULLY
VIOLATED RULE G-15(F) PROMULGATED BY THE MUNICIPAL SECURITIES
RULEMAKING BOARD ("MSRB") AND SECTION 15B(C)(1) OF THE
SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934 ("EXCHANGE ACT"), CENSURED
JPMS, AND IMPOSED A $54,000 PENALTY INVOLVING THE SALE OF NONINVESTMENT GRADE BONDS ISSUED BY THE COMMONWEALTH OF
PUERTO RICO ("PUERTO RICO") BY JPMS TO A CUSTOMER IN AN AMOUNT
BELOW THE MINIMUM DENOMINATION OF THE ISSUE. THE ORDER FINDS
THAT JPMS WILLFULLY VIOLATED MSRB RULE 6-15(F) BY EXECUTING ONE
SALES TRANSACTION IN THE PUERTO RICO BONDS WITH A CUSTOMER IN
AN AMOUNT BELOW THE $100,000 MINIMUM DENOMINATION OF THE
ISSUE. AS A RESULT OF JPMS'S WILLFUL VIOLATION OF MSRB RULE G15(F), JPMS WILLFULLY VIOLATED SECTION 15B(C)(1) OF THE EXCHANGE
ACT.

ITS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, AND TO INFORM THE COMMISSION
STAFF NO LATER THAN SIX MONTHS AFTER THAT ENTRY OF THE ORDER
THAT IT HAS COMPLIED WITH THE UNDERTAKINGS.

CONCLUSIONS OF LAW CONTAINED IN THE CONSENT ORDER, AND
CONSENTS TO THE ENTRY OF THE CONSENT ORDER BY OFI. JPMS ALSO
AGREED TO PAY OFI A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $51,900.00, WHICH WAS
REMITTED ON OR ABOUT SEPTEMBER 10, 2014.

Firm Statement

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY JPMS WITH A
MULTISTATE TASK FORCE COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF NASAA. AS PART
OF THE GLOBAL SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER CONSENT
ORDERS, IN WHICH JPMS NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE
ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, OFI ALLEGED THAT THE ACCEPTANCE
OF CLIENT ORDERS IN LOUISIANA THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS THAT
WERE NOT REGISTERED IN LOUISIANA AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE
MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS PERTAINING TO THE IDENTITY
OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS VIOLATED LSAR.S. 51:703, SECTION(A), LAC 10:XIII.1901 AND LAC 10:XIII.1701. WITHOUT
ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, JPMS AGREED TO MAKE, AND
ALREADY HAS MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS
REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER PROCESSES. JPMS
ALSO AGREED TO PAY OFI A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $51,900.00,
LOUISIANA'S ALLOCATED PORTION OF THE AMOUNT AGREED TO WITH
NASAA. FINALLY, OFI AND JPMS AGREED THAT THE CONSENT ORDER
WOULD NOT SUBJECT JPMS TO ANY DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE
FEDERAL LAWS, ANY STATE, THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO,
OR THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS
OF ANY SECURITIES OR COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR SELFREGULATORY ORGANIZATION, WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE
AGREEMENT WITH NASAA.

Sanction Details:

9/30/2014 - $50,400 ADMINISTRATIVE FINE PAID IN FULL.

Regulator Statement

ON SEPTEMBER 30, 2014, THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL REGULATION
ENTERED A FINAL ORDER AGAINST J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC, FOR
FAILING TO ESTABLISH AN ADEQUATE SYSTEM TO MONITOR THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF CLIENT SERVICES ASSOCIATES AND ENSURE
THE FIRM'S CLIENT SERVICES ASSOCIATES WERE PROPERLY
REGISTERED IN FLORIDA. THE FINAL ORDER FOLLOWS AN INVESTIGATION
INTO THE REGISTRATION OF J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC'S CLIENT
SERVICE ASSOCIATES AND SUPERVISORY SYSTEM BY THE NORTH
AMERICAN SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION (NASAA) MULTISTATE WORKING GROUP. J.P. MORGAN AGREED TO PAY AN
ADMINISTRATIVE FINE OF $50,400.

Monetary/Fine $50,400.00

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS
ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"), THE STATE OF FLORIDA OFFICE OF
FINANCIAL REGULATION ("OFFICE") ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN

ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN FLORIDA IN VIOLATION OF
FLORIDA STATUES ("F.S.")§ 517.12(1); JPMS FAILED TO MONITOR THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS

REGISTERED IN FLORIDA, WHICH CONSTITUTES GROUNDS TO IMPOSE

ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF F.S. § 517.161(1)(A) AND
RULE 69W-600.012(1)(D).

Allegations:

AS A RESULT OF 2011 AND 2013 EXAMINATIONS, THE CME'S MARKET
REGULATION DEPARTMENT FOUND THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC
DID NOT COMPLY WITH CME RULE 576. CME GROUP FOUND THAT ON 8
INSTANCES BETWEEN 2011 AND 2013 THE FIRM DID NOT PROPERLY
REGISTER TAG 50 USER IDS AND ALLOWED ORDERS TO BE ENTERED
USING INCORRECT TAG50 USER IDS.

User Guidance

Sanctions Ordered:

Monetary/Fine $1,000.00

Other Sanctions Ordered:
Sanction Details:

ON SEPTEMBER 23, 2014, A PANEL OF THE CME BUSINESS CONDUCT
COMMITTEE (THE "PANEL") ACCEPTED J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC'S
("JPMS") SETTLEMENT OFFER, IN WHICH JPMS NEITHER
ADMITTED NOR DENIED THE RULE VIOLATION. IN ACCORDANCE
THEREWITH, THE PANEL DECIDED THAT JPMS DID NOT COMPLY WITH
RULE 576 ("IDENTIFICATION OF GLOBEX TERMINAL OPERATORS") AND
ORDERED JPMS TO PAY $1,000 TO CME GROUP, INC. THE $1,000 PAYMENT
WAS MADE TO CME GROUP,INC. ON OCTOBER 9, 2014.

Firm Statement

IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SETTLEMENT OFFER, THE PANEL ORDERED
JPM TO PAY A FINE TO THE EXCHANGE IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,000. THE
FINE WAS PAID ON OCTOBER 9, 2014.

Disclosure 92 of 331
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS
ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"), THE STATE OF DELAWARE INVESTOR
PROTECTION UNIT (THE "UNIT") ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES
LLC ("JPMS") ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS
WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN DELAWARE IN VIOLATION OF THE
DELAWARE SECURITIES ACT (THE
"ACT") §§ 73-301(B) AND 73-304(A)(10), JPMS FAILED TO MONITOR THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES
ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE
THAT THESE PERSONS WERE REGISTERED IN DELAWARE IN VIOLATION
OF §§ 73-301(B), 73-304(A)(10), 73-304(A) AND 73-601 OF THE ACT, AND IN
CERTAIN INSTANCES, JPMS FAILED TO RECORD THE IDENTITY OF SALES
ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN
VIOLATION OF RULE 606 UNDER THE ACT.

Allegations:

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN
SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"), THE OFFICE
OF THE COMMISSIONER OF FINANCIAL
INSTITUTIONS OF PUERTO RICO ("OCFI") ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES LLC ("JPMS") ACCEPTED CLIENT
ORDERS THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN
PUERTO RICO IN VIOLATION OF THE PUERTO
RICO UNIFORM SECURITIES ACT ("ACT NO. 60") § 201(B) AND PUERTO RICO
UNIFORM SECURITIES ACT REGULATION
("REGULATION NO. 6078") § 6.5.1, JPMS FAILED TO MONITOR THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES
ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE
THAT THESE PERSONS WERE REGISTERED IN PUERTO RICO IN VIOLATION
OF ACT NO. 60 § 204(A)(2)(J) AND §§ 28.1 AND 28.2 OF REGULATION NO.
6078, AND JPMS FAILED TO RECORD THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS
ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF § 16.1 OF REGULATION NO.
6078.

Reporting Source:

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS
ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"), THE MISSOURI SECURITIES DIVISION (THE
"DIVISION") ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC ("JPMS")
ACCEPTED CLIENT
ORDERS THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN
MISSOURI IN VIOLATION OF RSMO. (CUM. SUPP. 2012) ("RSMO.") § 409.4402(D), JPMS FAILED TO MONITOR THE REGISTRATION
STATUS OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS SUPERVISORY
PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THESE PERSONS WERE REGISTERED IN
MISSOURI IN VIOLATION OF RSMO. § 409.4-412(D)(9), JPMS FAILED TO
RECORD THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT
ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF
RSMO. § 409.4-411(C)(1).

COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATION,
WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE AGREEMENT WITH NASAA.

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE

ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"), THE UTAH DIVISION OF SECURITIES (THE

ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE
NOT REGISTERED IN UTAH IN VIOLATION OF THE UTAH UNIFORM
SECURITIES ACT ("ACT") § 61-1-3(2)(A), JPMS FAILED TO MONITOR THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS
SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THESE PERSONS WERE
REGISTERED IN UTAH IN VIOLATION THE ACT § 61-1-6(2)(A)(II)(J), AND JPMS
FAILED TO RECORD THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING
CLIENT ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF UTAH ADMIN. CODE RULE ("RULE") R1645-1(C)(1).

www.finra.org/brokercheck

Firm Statement

User Guidance

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY JPMS WITH A
MULTISTATE TASK FORCE COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF NASAA. AS PART
OF THE GLOBAL SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER CONSENT
ORDERS, IN WHICH JPMS NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE
ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, THE DIVISION ALLEGED THAT THE
ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN UTAH THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS
THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN UTAH AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE
MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS PERTAINING TO THE IDENTITY
OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS VIOLATED THE
ACT §§ 61-1-3(2)(A) AND 61-1-6(2)(A)(II)(J), AND RULE R164-5-1(C)(1).
WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, JPMS AGREED TO
MAKE, AND ALREADY HAS MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS
REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER PROCESSES. JPMS
ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DIVISION A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $51,000.00,
UTAH'S ALLOCATED PORTION OF THE AMOUNT AGREED TO WITH NASAA.
FINALLY, THE DIVISION AND JPMS AGREED THAT THE ORDER WOULD NOT
SUBJECT JPMS TO ANY DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS,
ANY STATE, THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S.
VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY
SECURITIES OR COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR SELF-REGULATORY
ORGANIZATION, WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE AGREEMENT WITH
NASAA.

PROPERLY RECORD THE IDENTITY OF THE PERSON ACCEPTING CLIENT
ORDERS. J.P. MORGAN WAS ORDERED TO PAY $0,600 AS PART OF ITS

Allegations:

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN
SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"), THE
OKLAHOMA DEPARTMENT OF SECURITIES (THE
"DEPARTMENT") ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC ("JPMS")
ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS THROUGH SALES
ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN OKLAHOMA IN VIOLATION
OF THE OKLAHOMA UNIFORM SECURITIES ACT
(THE "ACT") § 1-402(D), JPMS FAILED TO MONITOR THE REGISTRATION
STATUS OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS AND
ENFORCE ITS SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THESE
PERSONS WERE REGISTERED IN OKLAHOMA IN VIOLATION OF § 1-411 OF
THE ACT AND RULE 660:11-5-42(B)(22)(A), JPMS FAILED TO RECORD THE
IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN
VIOLATION OF RULE 660:11-5-42(B)(18)(A).

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS
ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"), THE NORTH DAKOTA SECURITIES
DEPARTMENT (THE "DEPARTMENT") ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES LLC ("JPMS") ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS THROUGH SALES
ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN NORTH DAKOTA IN
VIOLATION OF THE N.D.C.C. § 10-04-10(2), JPMS FAILED TO MONITOR THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS TO ENSURE THAT
THESE PERSONS WERE REGISTERED IN NORTH DAKOTA IN VIOLATION OF
N.D.C.C. § 10-04-11(1)(M), AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, JPMS FAILED TO
RECORD THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT
ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF N.D.C.C. § 10-04-10.3(1)(A)(1).

$51,150.00 PAID 09/11/14

Regulator Statement

THIS MATTER WAS INITIATED AS A PART OF A MULTI-STATE TASK FORCE
INVESTIGATION COORDINATED BY NASAA. DURING THE PERIOD OF
JANUARY 1, 2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011, THE MAINE OFFICE OF
SECURITIES ALLEGED: (1) J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC ("JPMS") FAILED
TO ESTABLISH AN ADEQUATE SUPERVISORY SYSTEM TO MONITOR THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF PERSONS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS, IN
VIOLATION OF 32 M.R.S. 16412(4)(I), (2) JPMS FAILED TO ENSURE ITS
SALES ASSISTANTS WERE LICENSED IN ACCORDANCE WITH JPMS'S
WRITTEN PROCEDURES AND FAILED TO ENFORCE ITS ESTABLISHED
WRITTEN PROCEDURES IN VIOLATION OF MAINE RULE CH. 504 (7)(2), (3)
JPMS ACCEPTED ORDERS IN MAINE THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO
WERE NOT PROPERLY LICENSED IN MAINE VIOLATING 32 M.R.S. 16402(4),
AND (4) JPMS FAILED, IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, TO RECORD THE IDENTITY
OF THE PERSON ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF 32 M.R.S.
16411(3)(A)(2). THE FINE AMOUNT OF $51,150 WAS THE AMOUNT DUE TO
MAINE IN AN AGREED UPON SETTLEMENT WITH ALL 50 STATES, THE
DISTRICT
OF COLUMBIA,
RICO, AND THE US VIRGIN ISLANDS. THE
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about
J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES PUERTO
LLC
CONSENT ORDER WILL NOT SUBJECT JPMS TO ANY DISQUALIFICATIONS

278

JPMS ACCEPTED ORDERS IN MAINE THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO
WERE NOT PROPERLY LICENSED IN MAINE VIOLATING 32 M.R.S. 16402(4),
AND (4) JPMS FAILED, IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, TO RECORD THE IDENTITY
OF THE PERSON ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF 32 M.R.S.
16411(3)(A)(2). THE FINE AMOUNT OF $51,150 WAS THE AMOUNT DUE TO
MAINE IN AN AGREED UPON SETTLEMENT WITH ALL 50 STATES, THE
DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, AND THE US VIRGIN ISLANDS. THE
CONSENT ORDER WILL NOT SUBJECT JPMS TO ANY DISQUALIFICATIONS

PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR UNDER THE RULES OR

SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THESE PERSONS WERE
REGISTERED IN MAINE IN VIOLATION OF 32 M.R.S. § 16412(4)(1) AND MAINE
OFFICE OF SECURITIES RULE (THE "RULE") CHAPTER 504 § 7(2), AND JPMS
FAILED TO RECORD THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING

ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"), THE INDIANA SECURITIES DIVISION (THE
"DIVISION") ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC ("JPMS")
ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE
NOT REGISTERED IN INDIANA IN VIOLATION OF THE IND. CODE § 23-19-42(D), JPMS FAILED TO MONITOR THE REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE
SALES ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO
ENSURE THAT THESE PERSONS WERE REGISTERED IN INDIANA IN
VIOLATION OF 710 IND. ADMIN. CODE § 4-7-6(D)(1), AND IN CERTAIN
INSTANCES, JPMS FAILED TO RECORD THE IDENTITY OF SALES
ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF 710 IND.
ADMIN. CODE § 23-19-4-11(C).

Initiated By:

INDIANA SECURITIES DIVISION

Date Initiated:

08/18/2014

Docket/Case Number:

CAUSE NO. 14-0203 CO

Principal Product Type:

No Product

Sought:
Resolution:

Consent

Resolution Date:

08/18/2014

Sanctions Ordered:

Monetary/Fine $47,175.00

Other Sanctions Ordered:
Sanction Details:

JPMS NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE FINDINGS OF FACT AND
CONCLUSIONS OF LAW CONTAINED IN THE CONSENT ORDER, AND
CONSENTS TO THE ENTRY OF THE CONSENT ORDER BY THE DIVISION.
JPMS ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DIVISION A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF
$47,175.00, WHICH WAS REMITTED ON OR ABOUT AUGUST 15, 2014.

Firm Statement

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY JPMS WITH A
MULTISTATE TASK FORCE COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF NASAA. AS PART
OF THE GLOBAL SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER CONSENT
ORDERS, IN WHICH JPMS NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE
ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, THE DIVISION ALLEGED THAT THE
ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN INDIANA THROUGH SALES
ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN INDIANA AND IN CERTAIN
INSTANCES, THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS PERTAINING
TO THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN
ORDERS VIOLATED IND. CODE § 23-19-4-2(D) AND 710 IND. ADMIN. CODE §§
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC
4-7-6(D)(1) AND 23-19-4-11(C). WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE

281

www.finra.org/brokercheck

ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, THE DIVISION ALLEGED THAT THE
ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN INDIANA THROUGH SALES
ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN INDIANA AND IN CERTAIN
INSTANCES, THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS PERTAINING
TO THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN
ORDERS VIOLATED IND. CODE § 23-19-4-2(D) AND 710 IND. ADMIN. CODE §§
4-7-6(D)(1) AND 23-19-4-11(C). WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE
ALLEGATIONS, JPMS AGREED TO MAKE, AND ALREADY HAS MADE,
CERTAIN REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS REGISTRATION POLICIES,
PROCEDURES AND OTHER PROCESSES. JPMS ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE
DIVISION A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $47,175.00, INDIANA'S ALLOCATED
PORTION OF THE AMOUNT AGREED TO WITH NASAA. FINALLY, THE
DIVISION AND JPMS AGREED THAT THE CONSENT ORDER WOULD NOT
SUBJECT JPMS TO ANY DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS,
ANY STATE, THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S.
VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY
SECURITIES OR COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR SELF-REGULATORY
ORGANIZATION, WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE AGREEMENT WITH
NASAA.

ON AUGUST 18, 2047 THE ALABAMA SECURITIES COMMISSION AND J.P.
MORGAN SECURITIES ENTERED INTO A CONSENT ORDER WHICH
RESOLVED A MULTI-STATE INVESTIGATION INTO J.P. MORGAN'S USE OF

Regulator Statement

ON AUGUST 18, 2047 THE ALABAMA SECURITIES COMMISSION AND J.P.
MORGAN SECURITIES ENTERED INTO A CONSENT ORDER WHICH
RESOLVED A MULTI-STATE INVESTIGATION INTO J.P. MORGAN'S USE OF
UNREGISTERED SALES ASSISTANTS AND ITS FAILURE TO SUPERVISE. J.P.
MORGAN WAS ORDERED TO PAY $52,680 AS PART OF ITS SETTLEMENT
WITH THE STATE OF ALABAMA.

i
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS
ASSOCIATION INC., THE ALABAMA SECURITIES COMMISSION (THE
"COMMISSION") ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC ("JPMS")
ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE
NOT REGISTERED IN ALABAMA IN VIOLATION OF THE CODE OF ALABAMA
OF 1975 § 8-6-3(A), JPMS FAILED TO MONITOR THE REGISTRATION STATUS
OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS SUPERVISORY
PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THESE PERSONS WERE REGISTERED IN
ALABAMA IN VIOLATION OF ALABAMA SECURITIES COMMISSION'S RULE
830-X-3-.13(3), AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, JPMS FAILED TO RECORD THE
IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN
VIOLATION OF ALABAMA SECURITIES COMMISSION'S RULE 830-X-3-.14(M).

Initiated By:

ALABAMA SECURITIES COMMISSION

Date Initiated:

08/18/2014

Docket/Case Number:

CO-2014-0007

Monetary/Fine $52,680.00

Sanction Details:

JPMS NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE FINDINGS OF FACT AND
CONCLUSIONS OF LAW CONTAINED IN THE CONSENT ORDER, AND
CONSENTS TO THE ENTRY OF THE CONSENT ORDER BY THE
COMMISSION. JPMS ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE COMMISSION A SUM IN
THE AMOUNT OF $52,680.00, WHICH WAS REMITTED ON OR ABOUT
AUGUST 15, 2014.

Firm Statement

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY JPMS WITH A
MULTISTATE TASK FORCE COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF NASAA. AS PART
OF THE GLOBAL SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER CONSENT
ORDERS, IN WHICH JPMS NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE
ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, THE COMMISSION ALLEGED THAT THE
ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN ALABAMA THROUGH SALES
ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN ALABAMA AND IN CERTAIN
INSTANCES, THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS PERTAINING
TO THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN
ORDERS VIOLATED THE CODE OF ALABAMA OF 1975 § 8-6-3(A), AND
ALABAMA SECURITIES COMMISSION'S RULES 830-X-3-.13(3) AND 830-X3-.14(M). WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, JPMS
AGREED TO MAKE, AND ALREADY HAS MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL
CHANGES TO ITS REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER
PROCESSES. JPMS ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE COMMISSION A SUM IN
THE AMOUNT OF $52,680.00, ALABAMA'S ALLOCATED PORTION OF THE
AMOUNT AGREED TO WITH NASAA. FINALLY, THE COMMISSION AND JPMS
AGREED THAT THE CONSENT ORDER WOULD NOT SUBJECT JPMS TO ANY
DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS, ANY STATE, THE
DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR
UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY SECURITIES OR
COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATION,

Disclosure 101 of 331
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS
ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"), THE STATE OF ALASKA DIVISION OF
BANKING AND SECURITIES (THE "DIVISION") ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES LLC ("JPMS") ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS THROUGH SALES
ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN ALASKA IN VIOLATION OF
ALASKA STATUTE 45.55.030(A), JPMS FAILED TO MONITOR THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS
SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THESE PERSONS WERE
REGISTERED IN ALASKA IN VIOLATION OF ALASKA STATUTE 45.55.060(B)(1),
AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, JPMS FAILED TO RECORD THE IDENTITY OF
SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF ALASKA
SECURITIES REGULATION 3 AAC 08.030(A)(2).

Initiated By:

STATE OF ALASKA DIVISION OF BANKING AND SECURITIES

Date Initiated:

08/04/2014

Docket/Case Number:

User Guidance

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY JPMS WITH A
MULTISTATE TASK FORCE COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE NASAA. AS
PART OF THE GLOBAL SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER
CONSENT ORDERS, IN WHICH JPMS NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE
ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, THE DIVISION ALLEGED THAT THE
ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN ALASKA THROUGH SALES
ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN ALASKA AND IN CERTAIN
INSTANCES, THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS PERTAINING
TO THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN
ORDERS VIOLATED ALASKA STATUES 45.55.030(A) AND 45.55.060(B)(1) AND
ALASKA SECURITIES REGULATION 3 AAC 08.030(A)(2). WITHOUT
ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, JPMS AGREED TO MAKE, AND
ALREADY HAS MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS
REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER PROCESSES. JPMS
ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DIVISION A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $51,120.00,
ALASKA'S ALLOCATED PORTION OF THE AMOUNT AGREED TO WITH
NASAA. FINALLY, THE DIVISION AND JPMS AGREED THAT THE CONSENT

2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES LLC (THE "FIRM") WITH A MULTISTATE TASK FORCE
COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES
ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"). AS PART OF THE GLOBAL

WHICH THE FIRM NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE ALLEGATIONS. IN
THIS INSTANCE, THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE (THE
"DEPARTMENT") ALLEGED THAT THE ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN
MINNESOTA THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS
THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN MINNESOTA AND IN CERTAIN

THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS

©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC
2876.4114 SUBP. 4. WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS,

MINNESOTA THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS

THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS
ASSOCIATION INC., THE VERMONT SECURITIES DIVISION ALLEGED THAT
J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC (THE "FIRM") ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS
THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN VERMONT
IN VIOLATION OF 9 V.S.A. § 5401(C), THE FIRM FAILED TO MONITOR THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS
SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THESE PERSONS WERE
REGISTERED IN VERMONT IN VIOLATION OF 9 V.S.A. § 5412(D)(9), AND IN
CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE FIRM FAILED TO RECORD THE IDENTITY OF
SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF 9 V.S.A.
5411(C)(1).

J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC (THE "FIRM") NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES
THE FINDINGS OF FACT AND CONCLUSIONS OF LAW CONTAINED IN THE
CONSENT ORDER, AND CONSENTS TO THE ENTRY OF THE CONSENT
ORDER BY THE VERMONT SECURITIES DIVISION (THE "DIVISION"). THE
FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DIVISION
A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $51,840.00, WHICH WAS REMITTED ON OR
ABOUT JULY 21, 2014.

Firm Statement

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES LLC (THE "FIRM") WITH A MULTISTATE TASK FORCE
COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES
ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"). AS PART OF THE GLOBAL
SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER CONSENT ORDERS, IN
WHICH THE FIRM NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE ALLEGATIONS. IN
THIS INSTANCE, THE VERMONT SECURITIES DIVISION (THE "DIVISION")
ALLEGED THAT THE ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN VERMONT
THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN VERMONT
AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND
RECORDS PERTAINING TO
THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS
VIOLATED 9 V.S.A. §§ 5401(C), 5411(C)(1)
AND 5412(D)(9). WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, THE
FIRM AGREED TO MAKE, AND ALREADY
HAS MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS REGISTRATION
POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER PROCESSES. THE
FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DIVISION A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF
$51,840.00, VERMONT'S ALLOCATED PORTION OF THE AMOUNT AGREED
TO WITH NASAA. FINALLY, THE DIVISION AND THE FIRM AGREED THAT THE
CONSENT ORDER WOULD NOT SUBJECT THE FIRM TO ANY
DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS, ANY STATE, THE
DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR
UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY SECURITIES OR
COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATION,
WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE AGREEMENT WITH NASAA.

Disclosure 104 of 331
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS
ASSOCIATION INC., THE MONTANA SECURITIES DEPARTMENT ALLEGED
THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC (THE "FIRM") ACCEPTED CLIENT
ORDERS THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN
MONTANA IN VIOLATION OF MONT. CODE ANN. § 30-10-201(2), THE FIRM
FAILED TO MONITOR THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS
SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THESE PERSONS WERE
REGISTERED IN MONTANA IN VIOLATION OF MONT. CODE ANN. § 30-10201(13)(K), AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE FIRM FAILED TO RECORD THE
IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN
VIOLATION OF MONT. CODE ANN. § 30-10-201(12)(A) AND ADMIN. R MONT.
6.10.504.

User Guidance

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES LLC (THE "FIRM") WITH A MULTISTATE TASK FORCE
COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES
ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"). AS
PART OF THE GLOBAL SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER
CONSENT ORDERS, IN WHICH THE FIRM NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES
THE ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, THE MONTANA SECURITIES
DEPARTMENT (THE "DEPARTMENT") ALLEGED THAT THE ACCEPTANCE OF
CLIENT ORDERS IN MONTANA THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS
THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN MONTANA AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES,
THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS PERTAINING TO THE
IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS
VIOLATED MONT. CODE ANN. §§ 30-10-201(2), 30-10-201(12)(A) AND 30-10201(13)(K), AND ADMIN. R MONT. 6.10.504. WITHOUT ADMITTING OR
DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, THE FIRM AGREED TO MAKE, AND ALREADY
HAS MADE, CERTAIN
REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND
OTHER PROCESSES. THE FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DEPARTMENT A
SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $50,150.00, MONTANA'S ALLOCATED PORTION OF
THE AMOUNT AGREED TO WITH NASAA. FINALLY, THE DEPARTMENT AND
THE FIRM AGREED THAT THE CONSENT ORDER WOULD NOT SUBJECT THE
FIRM TO ANY DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS, ANY
STATE, THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA,PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S. VIRGIN
ISLANDS, OR UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY SECURITIES
OR COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATION,
WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE AGREEMENT
WITH NASAA.

ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC (THE "FIRM") ACCEPTED
CLIENT ORDERS THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS
WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN VIRGINIA IN VIOLATION OF SECTION 13.1504 A OF THE VIRGINIA SECURITIES ACT,

SALES ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS
SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THESE PERSONS WERE

ADMINISTRATIVE CODE (THE "CODE"), AND IN
CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE FIRM FAILED TO RECORD THE IDENTITY OF
SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS
IN VIOLATION OF RULE 21 VAC 5-20-240 OF THE CODE.

ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES

2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") WITH A MULTISTATE TASK FORCE

ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"). AS

RECORDS PERTAINING TO THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO
ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS VIOLATED S.C. CODE ANN. SECTIONS 35-1402(D) AND 35-1-412(D)(9) AND SOUTH CAROLINA REGULATION 13-405(A).
WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, THE FIRM AGREED

REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER PROCESSES. THE
FIRM ALSO AGREED

i
Disclosure 108 of 331
Reporting Source:

Regulator

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

CFTC RELEASE PR6968-14, JULY 29, 2014: THE CFTC HAS REASON TO
BELIEVE THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC VIOLATED THE COMMODITY
EXCHANGE ACT AND COMMISSION REGULATIONS. THEREFORE, THE
COMMISSION DEEMS IT APPROPRIATE AND IN THE PUBLIC INTEREST THAT
PUBLIC ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEEDINGS BE, AND HEREBY ARE,
INSTITUTED TO DETERMINE WHETHER THE FIRM HAS ENGAGED IN THE
VIOLATIONS AND TO DETERMINE WHETHER ANY ORDER SHOULD BE
ISSUED IMPOSING REMEDIAL SANCTIONS. IN ANTICIPATION OF THE
INSTITUTION OF THIS ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEEDING, THE FIRM HAS
SUBMITTED AN OFFER OF SETTLEMENT, WHICH THE COMMISSION HAS
DETERMINED TO ACCEPT. WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING ANY OF THE
FINDINGS OR CONCLUSIONS HEREIN, THE FIRM CONSENTS TO THE
ENTRY OF THIS ORDER INSTITUTING PROCEEDINGS PURSUANT TO
SECTIONS 6(C) AND 6(D) OF THE COMMODITY EXCHANGE ACT, MAKING
FINDINGS AND IMPOSING REMEDIAL SANCTIONS AND ACKNOWLEDGES
SERVICE OF THIS ORDER. SINCE AT LEAST 2012, THE COMMISSION BEGAN
NOTIFYING THE FIRM ABOUT ERRORS IN ITS LARGE TRADER REPORTS,
WHICH INCREASED IN FREQUENCY THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. IN
DECEMBER 2012, THE FIRM WAS NOTIFIED BY THE COMMISSION THAT THE
ON-GOING PROBLEMS WERE UNACCEPTABLE. THE FIRM USED A THIRDPARTY VENDOR FOR THE PREPARATION OF ITS LARGE TRADER REPORTS.
THE FIRM, RELYING ON THAT THIRD-PARTY VENDOR, ASSURED
COMMISSION STAFF THAT THE PROBLEM, WHICH IT UNDERSTOOD AT THE
TIME TO BE RELATED TO AVERAGE PRICE TRANSACTIONS, WOULD BE
RESOLVED ON OR BEFORE THE END OF JANUARY 2013. HOWEVER, THE
FIRM DID NOT RESOLVE ALL OF ITS REPORTING ISSUES AND CONTINUED
TO SUBMIT LARGE TRADER REPORTS THAT CONTAINED HUNDREDS OF
ERRORS THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD FROM FEBRUARY 1, 2013 TO
FEBRUARY 2014. DURING THE RELEVANT PERIOD, THE FIRM'S LARGE
TRADER REPORTS FAILED ON MULTIPLE OCCASIONS TO REPORT THE
ACTUAL NUMBER OF DELIVERY NOTICES ISSUED AND STOPPED AND
INACCURATELY REPORTED THE NUMBER OF EXCHANGES FOR RELATED
POSITIONS BOUGHT AND SOLD. THE FIRM FAILED TO FULLY AND TIMELY
CORRECT THE REPORTING ERRORS DURING THE RELEVANT PERIOD.

Initiated By:

COMMODITY FUTURES TRADING COMMISSION

Date Initiated:

07/29/2014

©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved.

Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC

www.finra.org/brokercheck

07/29/2014

Does the order constitute a
final order based on
violations of any laws or
regulations that prohibit
fraudulent, manipulative, or
deceptive conduct?
Sanctions Ordered:

No

Other Sanctions Ordered:

THE FIRM SHALL CEASE AND DESIST FROM VIOLATING SECTION 4G(A) OF
THE ACT, 7 U.S.C. § 6G(A) (2012), AND COMMISSION REGULATION 17.
00(A)(1), 17 C.F.R. § 17.00 (A)(1) (2013).

Monetary/Fine $650,000.00
Cease and Desist/Injunction

THE FIRM SHALL PAY THE CIVIL MONETARY PENALTY WITHIN 10 BUSINESS
DAYS OF THE DATE OF THE ENTRY OF THIS ORDER.
THE FIRM AND ITS SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS SHALL COMPLY WITH THE
CONDITIONS AND UNDERTAKINGS SET FORTH IN THE OFFER.
Sanction Details:

SEE ABOVE

i
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

ON JULY 29, 2014, J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC ("JPMS" OR THE "FIRM"),
WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING CERTAIN
U.S. COMMODITY FUTURES TRADING COMMISSION (THE "COMMISSION")
FINDINGS, CONSENTED TO A FINE OF
$650,000, WAS ORDERED TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM VIOLATING
SECTION 4G(A) OF THE COMMODITY EXCHANGE
ACT, 7 U.S.C. § 6G(A) (2012), AND COMMISSION REGULATION 17.00(A)(L), 17
C.F.R. § 17.00(A)(I) (2013), AND
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about
J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES
LLCAN UNDERTAKING. THE COMMISSION ALLEGED
AGREED
TO COMPLY
WITH
THAT JPMS: 1) SUBMITTED LARGE TRADER

298

www.finra.org/brokercheck

U.S. COMMODITY FUTURES TRADING COMMISSION (THE "COMMISSION")
FINDINGS, CONSENTED TO A FINE OF
$650,000, WAS ORDERED TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM VIOLATING
SECTION 4G(A) OF THE COMMODITY EXCHANGE
ACT, 7 U.S.C. § 6G(A) (2012), AND COMMISSION REGULATION 17.00(A)(L), 17
C.F.R. § 17.00(A)(I) (2013), AND
AGREED TO COMPLY WITH AN UNDERTAKING. THE COMMISSION ALLEGED
THAT JPMS: 1) SUBMITTED LARGE TRADER
REPORTS THAT INCORRECTLY REPORTED THE NUMBER OF DELIVERY
NOTICES ISSUED AND STOPPED AND THE NUMBER OF EXCHANGE FOR
RELATED POSITIONS BOUGHT AND SOLD FROM FEBRUARY 1, 2013 TO
FEBRUARY 2014 ("RELEVANT PERIOD") AND 2) DID NOT FULLY AND TIMELY
CORRECT THE REPORTING ERRORS DURING THE RELEVANT
PERIOD.

07/29/2014

Cease and Desist/Injunction

Other Sanctions Ordered:

UNDERTAKING

Sanction Details:

THE ORDER REQUIRES THAT JPMS LLC CEASE AND DESIST FROM
VIOLATING SECTION 4 G(A) OF THE ACT, 7 U.S.C., 6G(A) (2012), AND
COMMISSION REGULATION 17.00(A)(1), 17 C.F.R; 17.00(A)(1) (2013). THE
ORDER ALSO REQUIRES JPMS LLC TO PAY A CIVIL MONEY PENALTY OF
$650,000, WHICH WAS PAID ON AUGUST 6, 2014, AND COMPLY WITH AN
UNDERTAKING.

Firm Statement

WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE FINDINGS, THE FIRM CONSENTED
TO THE ORDER AND TO THE ENTRY OF
FINDINGS THAT DURING THE PERIOD FEBRUARY 1, 2013 THROUGH
FEBRUARY 2014 ("REVIEW PERIOD") IT VIOLATED
SECTION 4G(A) OF THE COMMODITY EXCHANGE ACT, 7 U.S.C. § 6G(A), AND
COMMISSION REGULATION 17.00(A)(1),17
C.F.R. § 17.00(A)(1) IN THAT IT SUBMITTED LARGE TRADER REPORTS THAT
INCORRECTLY REPORTED THE NUMBER OF
DELIVERY NOTICES ISSUED AND STOPPED AND THE NUMBER OF
EXCHANGE FOR RELATED POSITIONS BOUGHT AND SOLD. IN ADDITION,
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC
THE FIRM CONSENTED TO FINDINGS THAT IT FAILED TO FULLY AND TIMELY

299

SECTION 4G(A) OF THE COMMODITY EXCHANGE ACT, 7 U.S.C. § 6G(A), AND

Disclosure 109 of 331
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN
SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC., THE GEORGIA
SECURITIES DIVISION ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS THROUGH
SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED
IN GEORGIA IN VIOLATION OF SECTION 10-5-3(A) OF THE GEORGIA
SECURITIES ACT OF 1973 ("1973 ACT") AND
SECTION 10-5-31(D) OF THE GEORGIA UNIFORM SECURITIES ACT OF 2008
("2008 ACT"), THE FIRM FAILED TO
MONITOR THE REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS AND
ENFORCE ITS SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES
TO ENSURE THAT THESE PERSONS WERE REGISTERED IN GEORGIA IN
VIOLATION SECTION 10-5-4(A)(11) AND RULE
590-4-5-.07(1) OF THE 1973 ACT AND SECTION 10-5-41(D)(9) AND RULE 5904-5-.12(1) OF THE 2008 ACT, AND IN
CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE FIRM FAILED TO RECORD THE IDENTITY OF
SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS
IN VIOLATION OF RULE 590-4-2-.03(1) OF THE 1973 ACT AND SECTION 10-540(C)(1) AND RULE 590-4-5-.06(1) OF
THE 2008 ACT.

www.finra.org/brokercheck

User Guidance

Resolution Date:

06/30/2014

Sanctions Ordered:

Monetary/Fine $50,050.00

Other Sanctions Ordered:
Sanction Details:

J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES
THE FINDINGS OF FACT AND CONCLUSIONS OF LAW CONTAINED IN THE
CONSENT ORDER, AND CONSENTS TO THE ENTRY OF THE CONSENT
ORDER BY THE GEORGIA SECURITIES DIVISION (THE "DIVISION"). THE
FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DIVISION
A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $50,050.00 WHICH WAS REMITTED IN OR ABOUT
JUNE 2014.

Firm Statement

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") WITH A MULTISTATE TASK FORCE
COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES
ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"). AS
PART OF THE GLOBAL SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER
CONSENT ORDERS, IN WHICH THE FIRM NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES
THE ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, THE GEORGIA SECURITIES
DIVISION (THE "DIVISION") ALLEGED THAT THE ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT
ORDERS IN GEORGIA THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT
REGISTERED IN GEORGIA AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE
MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS PERTAINING TO
THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS
VIOLATED SECTIONS 10-5-3(A) AND 10-54(A)(11) AND RULES 590-4-2-.03(1) AND 590-4-2.07(1) OF THE GEORGIA
SECURITIES ACT OF 1973 AND SECTIONS
10-5-31(D), 10-5-4(C)(1) AND 10-5-41(D)(9) AND RULES 590-4-5-.06(1) AND
590-4-5.12(1) OF GEORGIA UNIFORM
SECURITIES ACT OF 2008. WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE
ALLEGATIONS, THE FIRM AGREED TO MAKE, AND
ALREADY HAS MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS
REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER
PROCESSES. THE FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DIVISION A SUM IN THE
AMOUNT OF $50,050.00, WHICH
CONSISTED OF $5,050.00 AS AN ASSESSMENT OF REGISTRATION FEES
AND $45,000.00 TO REIMBURSE THE DIVISION
FOR COSTS INCURRED DURING THE INVESTIGATION OF THIS MATTER.
FINALLY, THE DIVISION AND THE FIRM AGREED
THAT THE CONSENT ORDER WOULD NOT SUBJECT THE FIRM TO ANY
DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS, ANY STATE, THE
DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR
UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY SECURITIES OR
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about
J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES
LLC OR SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATION,
COMMODITIES
REGULATORY
WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE AGREEMENT WITH NASAA.

301

www.finra.org/brokercheck

FOR COSTS INCURRED DURING THE INVESTIGATION OF THIS MATTER.
FINALLY, THE DIVISION AND THE FIRM AGREED
THAT THE CONSENT ORDER WOULD NOT SUBJECT THE FIRM TO ANY
DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS, ANY STATE, THE
DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR
UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY SECURITIES OR
COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATION,
WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE AGREEMENT WITH NASAA.

i
Disclosure 110 of 331
Reporting Source:

Regulator

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE FINDINGS, THE FIRM CONSENTED
TO THE SANCTIONS AND TO THE ENTRY OF FINDINGS THAT ON 26
OCCASIONS, IT VIOLATED NYSE RULE 92(A) BY ENTERING A PROPRIETARY
ORDER TO BUY OR SELL AN NYSE-LISTED SECURITY WHILE KNOWINGLY
IN POSSESSION OF A CUSTOMER ORDER TO BUY OR SELL THE SECURITY
THAT COULD HAVE BEEN EXECUTED AT THE SAME PRICE. THE FIRM THEN
TRADED FOR ITS PROPRIETARY ORDER AHEAD OF OR ALONGSIDE THE
CUSTOMER ORDER OR TRADED OUTSIDE THE CUSTOMER'S CONSENT
PARAMETERS. IN THREE OF THE 26 INSTANCES, THE FIRM EXECUTED
RISKLESS PRINCIPAL TRADES PURSUANT TO NYSE RULE 92(C), BUT
FAILED TO COMPLY WITH ONE OR MORE REQUIREMENTS OF RULE 92(C),
THEREBY VIOLATING RULE 92(A). IN ADDITION, IN TWO INSTANCES, WHILE
HOLDING EXECUTABLE CUSTOMER ORDERS, THE FIRM ROUTED
PROPRIETARY ORDERS TO ITS FLOOR BROKERS WITHOUT MARKING
THEM AS G ORDERS. THE FIRM'S FLOOR BROKERS THEN EXECUTED THE
PROPRIETARY ORDERS BY ENTERING THEM AS E-QUOTES INSTEAD OF GQUOTES, THEREBY VIOLATING EXCHANGE ACT RULE 17A-3(A)(6)(I), AND
NYSE RULES 92(A), 410(B) AND 440. WITH RESPECT TO ONE OF THE
INSTANCES, AS A RESULT OF ENTERING A PROPRIETARY ORDER AS AN EQUOTE RATHER THAN A G-QUOTE, THE FIRM FAILED TO YIELD TO ORDERS
FOR NON-MEMBERS AND NON-MEMBER ORGANIZATIONS IN 61
INSTANCES, THEREBY VIOLATING EXCHANGE ACT SECTION 11(A)(1),
EXCHANGE ACT RULE 11A-1(A), AND NYSE RULE 90(A). MOREOVER, IN FIVE
INSTANCES IN WHICH THE FIRM EXECUTED TRANSACTIONS PURSUANT
TO NYSE RULE 92(C), THE FIRM FAILED TO ACCURATELY DOCUMENT THE
TIME IT HAD VERBALLY RECEIVED ITS CUSTOMERS' ORDERS IN
VIOLATION OF EXCHANGE ACT RULE 17A-3(A)(6)(I) AND NYSE RULES
410(A)(1) AND 440. FURTHERMORE, THE FIRM VIOLATED NYSE RULE 342(A)
AND (B) IN THAT IT FAILED TO DISCHARGE ITS DUTIES ADEQUATELY WITH
RESPECT TO SUPERVISION AND CONTROL OF ITS TRADERS' ACTIVITIES
RELATED TO THE FIRM'S BUSINESS AND COMPLIANCE WITH NYSE RULE
92(A) AND FAILED TO ENSURE SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY WAS
PROPERLY EXERCISED. THE FIRM FAILED TO DETECT CERTAIN
INSTANCES IN WHICH IT HAD EXECUTED PROPRIETARY TRANSACTIONS IN
VIOLATION OF RULE 92(A). IN OTHER INSTANCES, ALTHOUGH ITS
SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM HAD DETECTED PROPRIETARY TRADES WHILE
HOLDING EXECUTABLE CUSTOMER ORDERS, THE FIRM FAILED TO
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC
IDENTIFY THE TRANSACTIONS AS VIOLATING RULE 92(A).

302

www.finra.org/brokercheck

92(A) AND FAILED TO ENSURE SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY WAS
PROPERLY EXERCISED. THE FIRM FAILED TO DETECT CERTAIN
INSTANCES IN WHICH IT HAD EXECUTED PROPRIETARY TRANSACTIONS IN
VIOLATION OF RULE 92(A). IN OTHER INSTANCES, ALTHOUGH ITS
SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM HAD DETECTED PROPRIETARY TRADES WHILE
HOLDING EXECUTABLE CUSTOMER ORDERS, THE FIRM FAILED TO
IDENTIFY THE TRANSACTIONS AS VIOLATING RULE 92(A).

i
Disclosure 111 of 331
Reporting Source:

Regulator

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

THE ARKANSAS SECURITIES COMMISSIONER ENTERED INTO A CONSENT
ORDER (ORDER NO. S-14-0034-14-OR01) WITH J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES
LLC ("JPMS") ON JULY 28, 2014. THE CONSENT ORDER WAS BASED ON A
GLOBAL SETTLEMENT BETWEEN JPMS AND A NUMBER OF STATES, LED BY
A MEMBER TASK FORCE OF THE NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES
ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION ("NASAA"), REGARDING JPMS'S FAILURE
TO PROPERLY REGISTER CERTAIN SALES ASSISTANTS AS BROKERDEALER REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVES AS WELL AS ITS FAILURE TO
DEVELOP A SUPERVISORY SYSTEM REASONABLY DESIGNED TO PREVENT
SALES ASSISTANTS FROM ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS FROM
JURISDICTIONS WHERE THE SALES ASSISTANTS WERE NOT REGISTERED.
ADDITIONALLY, THE INVESTIGATION FOUND THAT A TRADE ENTRY SYSTEM
USED BY SOME JPMS BUSINESS UNITS WAS NOT DESIGNED TO RECORD
THE IDENTITY OF THE PERSON WHO ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS. AS A
RESULT, JPMS VIOLATED THE BOOKS & RECORDS REQUIREMENTS BY
FAILING TO MAINTAIN A RECORD IDENTIFYING THE ACCEPTOR OF MANY
CLIENT ORDERS FROM 2008 TO 2011. JPMS CONSEQUENTLY ENGAGED IN
CONDUCT GIVING RISE TO LIABILITY UNDER ARK. CODE ANN. §§ 23-42-301,
306, AND 308, AND RULE 306.01 OF THE RULES OF THE ARKANSAS
SECURITIES COMMISSIONER. JPMS AGREED TO PAY $2,790,625 TO BE
DISTRIBUTED AMONG THE 50 STATES, THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA,
PUERTO RICO, AND THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS. THE CONSENT ORDER
IMPOSED A PENALTY OF $53,925.00 AS ARKANSAS'S PORTION OF THE
TOTAL SETTLEMENT AMOUNT.

Initiated By:

ARKANSAS SECURITIES DEPARTMENT

Date Initiated:
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved.

07/28/2014
Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC

305

www.finra.org/brokercheck

Sanction Details:

JPMS PAID THE SUM OF $53,925.00 TO THE ARKANSAS SECURITIES
DEPARTMENT WITHIN TEN DAYS OF THE ENTRY OF THE CONSENT ORDER.

Regulator Statement

THE CONSENT ORDER WAS BASED ON A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT BETWEEN
JPMS AND A NUMBER OF STATES, WHICH RESULTED FROM AN
INVESTIGATION AND SETTLEMENT NEGOTIATION LED BY A MEMBER TASK
FORCE OF NASAA.

i
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS
ASSOCIATION INC., THE ARKANSAS SECURITIES DEPARTMENT ALLEGED
THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC (THE "FIRM") ACCEPTED CLIENT
ORDERS THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN
ARKANSAS IN VIOLATION OF ARKANSAS CODE ANN. § 23-42-301(B)(1), THE
FIRM FAILED TO
MONITOR THE REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS AND
ENFORCE ITS SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THESE
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about
J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES
LLC
PERSONS
WERE
REGISTERED
IN ARKANSAS IN VIOLATION OF ARKANSAS
CODE ANN. § 23-42-308(A)(2)(J), AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE FIRM

306

www.finra.org/brokercheck

THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC (THE "FIRM") ACCEPTED CLIENT
ORDERS THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN
ARKANSAS IN VIOLATION OF ARKANSAS CODE ANN. § 23-42-301(B)(1), THE
FIRM FAILED TO
MONITOR THE REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS AND
ENFORCE ITS SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THESE
PERSONS WERE REGISTERED IN ARKANSAS IN VIOLATION OF ARKANSAS
CODE ANN. § 23-42-308(A)(2)(J), AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE FIRM
FAILED TO RECORD THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING
CLIENT ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF ARKANSAS CODE ANN. § 23-42-306(A)
AND RULE 306.01(A).

J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC (THE "FIRM") NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES
THE FINDINGS OF FACT AND CONCLUSIONS OF LAW CONTAINED IN THE
CONSENT ORDER, AND CONSENTS TO THE ENTRY OF THE CONSENT
ORDER BY THE ARKANSAS SECURITIES DEPARTMENT (THE
"DEPARTMENT"). THE FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE
DEPARTMENT A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $53,925.00, WHICH WAS
REMITTED ON OR ABOUT JULY 21, 2014.

Firm Statement

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES LLC (THE "FIRM") WITH A MULTISTATE TASK FORCE
COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES
ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"). AS
PART OF THE GLOBAL SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER
CONSENT ORDERS, IN WHICH THE FIRM NEITHER
ADMITS NOR DENIES THE ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, THE
ARKANSAS SECURITIES DEPARTMENT (THE "DEPARTMENT") ALLEGED
THAT THE ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN ARKANSAS THROUGH
SALES ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN ARKANSAS AND IN
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC
CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND

307

www.finra.org/brokercheck

PART OF THE GLOBAL SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER
CONSENT ORDERS, IN WHICH THE FIRM NEITHER
ADMITS NOR DENIES THE ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, THE
ARKANSAS SECURITIES DEPARTMENT (THE "DEPARTMENT") ALLEGED
THAT THE ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN ARKANSAS THROUGH
SALES ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN ARKANSAS AND IN
CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND
RECORDS PERTAINING TO THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO
ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS VIOLATED ARKANSAS CODE ANN. §§ 23-42301(B)(1), 23-42-306(A) AND 23-42-308(A)(2)(J), AND RULE 306.01(A).
WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, THE FIRM AGREED
TO MAKE, AND ALREADY HAS MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS
REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER PROCESSES. THE
FIRM ALSO AGREED
TO PAY THE DEPARTMENT A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $53,925.00,
ARKANSAS'S ALLOCATED PORTION OF THE AMOUNT AGREED TO WITH
NASAA. FINALLY, THE DEPARTMENT AND THE FIRM AGREED THAT THE
CONSENT ORDER WOULD NOT SUBJECT THE FIRM TO ANY
DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS, ANY STATE, THE
DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR
UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY SECURITIES OR
COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATION,
WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE AGREEMENT
WITH NASAA.

Disclosure 112 of 331
Reporting Source:

Regulator

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE FINDINGS, THE FIRM CONSENTED
TO THE SANCTIONS AND TO THE ENTRY OF FINDINGS THAT IT FAILED TO
ESTABLISH, MAINTAIN, AND ENFORCE WRITTEN POLICIES AND
PROCEDURES REASONABLY DESIGNED TO PREVENT THE EXECUTION OR
DISPLAY OF A NON-EXEMPT SHORT SALE IN A SECURITY SUBJECT TO A
SHORT SALE CIRCUIT BREAKER AT A PRICE AT OR BELOW THE NATIONAL
BEST BID. THE FINDINGS STATED THAT THE FIRM EXECUTED SHORT SALE
TRANSACTIONS AND FAILED TO REPORT EACH OF THESE TRANSACTIONS
TO THE FINRA/NASDAQ TRADE REPORTING FACILITY (FNTRF) WITH A
SHORT SALE MODIFIER. THE FIRM'S SUPERVISORY SYSTEM DID NOT
PROVIDE FOR SUPERVISION REASONABLY DESIGNED TO ACHIEVE
COMPLIANCE WITH RESPECT TO RULE 201(B) OF REGULATION SHO.

Disclosure 113 of 331
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH
AMERICAN SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC., THE RHODE
ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF
BUSINESS REGULATION ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC
(THE "FIRM") ACCEPTED CLIENT
ORDERS THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN
RHODE ISLAND IN VIOLATION OF
R.I. GEN. LAWS SECTION 7-11-201(A), THE FIRM FAILED TO MONITOR THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS
SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THESE PERSONS WERE
REGISTERED IN RHODE ISLAND IN VIOLATION OF R.I. GEN. LAWS SECTION
7-11-212(B)(11), AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE FIRM FAILED TO RECORD
THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN
VIOLATION OF R.I. GEN. LAWS SECTION 7-11-209(D).

J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES

JUNE 23, 2014.

Firm Statement

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") WITH A MULTISTATE TASK FORCE
COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES
ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"). AS PART OF THE GLOBAL
SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER CONSENT ORDERS, IN
WHICH THE FIRM NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE
ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF
BUSINESS REGULATION (THE "DEPARTMENT") ALLEGED THAT THE
ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN RHODE ISLAND THROUGH SALES
ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN RHODE ISLAND AND IN
CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS
PERTAINING TO THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO
ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS VIOLATED R.I. GEN. LAWS SECTIONS 7-11201(A), 7-11-212(B)(11) AND 7-11-209(D). WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING
THE ALLEGATIONS, THE FIRM AGREED TO MAKE, AND ALREADY HAS
MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS REGISTRATION POLICIES,
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about
J.P. MORGAN AND
SECURITIES
LLCPROCESSES. THE FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY
PROCEDURES
OTHER
THE DEPARTMENT A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $51,720.00, RHODE ISLAND'S

311

CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS

Allegations:

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN
SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC., THE MISSISSIPPI
SECURITIES DIVISION ALLEGED THAT J.P.
MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS
THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT
REGISTERED IN MISSISSIPPI, THE FIRM FAILED TO MONITOR THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES
ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE
THAT THESE PERSONS WERE REGISTERED IN MISSISSIPPI IN VIOLATION
OF MISSISSIPPI SECURITIES ACT RULE 519 AND ITS PREDECESSOR RULE,
RULE 521, AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE FIRM FAILED TO RECORD THE
IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN
VIOLATION OF MISSISSIPPI SECURITIES ACT RULE 515A AND ITS
PREDECESSOR RULE, RULE 515A.

Sanction Details:

J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES
THE FINDINGS OF FACT AND CONCLUSIONS OF LAW CONTAINED IN THE
CONSENT ORDER, AND CONSENTS TO THE ENTRY OF THE CONSENT
ORDER BY THE MISSISSIPPI SECURITIES DIVISION (THE "DIVISION"). THE
FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE
DIVISION A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $50,550.00, WHICH WAS REMITTED IN
OR ABOUT JUNE 2014.

Firm Statement

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") WITH A MULTISTATE TASK FORCE
COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES
ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"). AS PART OF THE GLOBAL
SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER CONSENT ORDERS, IN
WHICH THE FIRM NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE ALLEGATIONS. IN
THIS INSTANCE, THE MISSISSIPPI SECURITIES DIVISION (THE "DIVISION")
ALLEGED THAT THE FIRM'S FAILURE TO MONITOR THE REGISTRATION
STATUS OF SALES ASSISTANTS
THAT ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS IN MISSISSIPPI AND WHO WERE NOT
REGISTERED IN MISSISSIPPI, AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE
MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS PERTAINING TO THE IDENTITY
OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS VIOLATED
MISSISSIPPI SECURITIES ACT RULES 519 AND 515A AND ITS
PREDECESSOR RULES, RULES 521 AND 515A. WITHOUT ADMITTING OR
DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, THE FIRM AGREED TO MAKE, AND
ALREADY HAS MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS
REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER
PROCESSES. THE FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DIVISION A SUM IN THE
AMOUNT OF $50,550.00, MISSISSIPPI'S
ALLOCATED PORTION OF THE AMOUNT AGREED TO WITH NASAA. FINALLY,
THE DIVISION AND THE FIRM AGREED THAT
THE CONSENT ORDER WOULD NOT SUBJECT THE FIRM TO ANY
DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS, ANY
STATE, THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S. VIRGIN
ISLANDS, OR UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY SECURITIES
OR COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATION,
WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE AGREEMENT WITH NASAA.

Allegations:

UNDERWRITER, THE FIRM FAILED TO REPORT NEW ISSUE OFFERINGS IN
TRADE REPORTING AND COMPLIANCE ENGINE (TRACE)-ELIGIBLE
CORPORATE DEBT SECURITIES TO FINRA ACCORDING TO THE TIME
FRAMES SET FORTH IN FINRA RULE 6760(C). THE FINDINGS STATED THAT
THE FIRM FAILED TO REPORT P1 TRANSACTIONS IN TRACE-ELIGIBLE
SECURITIES TO TRACE THAT IT WAS REQUIRED TO REPORT, FAILED TO
REPORT THE CORRECT CONTRA-PARTY'S IDENTIFIER FOR P1
TRANSACTIONS IN TRACE-ELIGIBLE SECURITIES TO TRACE AND FAILED
TO ACCURATELY REPORT THE MARKET IDENTIFIER FOR P1
TRANSACTIONS IN TRACE-ELIGIBLE SECURITIES TO TRACE. THE FINDINGS
ALSO STATED THAT THE FIRM FAILED TO ENFORCE ITS WRITTEN
SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES CONCERNING REPORTING OF P1
TRANSACTIONS IN TRACE-ELIGIBLE SECURITIES.

TRANSACTIONS AND FAILED TO ACCURATELY REPORT TO TRACE THE
MARKET IDENTIFIER FOR CERTAIN TRANSACTIONS. THE FINDINGS ALSO
STATED THAT THE FIRM FAILED TO ENFORCE ITS WRITTEN SUPERVISORY
PROCEDURES CONCERNING REPORTING OF P1 TRANSACTIONS IN
TRACE-ELIGIBLE SECURITIES.

www.finra.org/brokercheck

User Guidance

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN
SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC., THE STATE OF
CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS OVERSIGHT
ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") ACCEPTED
CLIENT ORDERS THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS
WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN CALIFORNIA IN VIOLATION OF
CALIFORNIA CORPORATE SECURITIES LAW OF 1968
("CSL") SECTION 25210(B), , THE FIRM FAILED TO MONITOR THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE SALES
ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO ENSURE
THAT THESE PERSONS WERE REGISTERED IN
CALIFORNIA IN VIOLATION OF CSL SECTION 25217(A) AND CALIFORNIA
CODE OF REGULATIONS, TITLE 10, SECTION
260.218.4, AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE FIRM FAILED TO RECORD THE
IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS
ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF CSL SECTION 25241.

Firm Statement

CONCLUSIONS OF LAW CONTAINED IN THE CONSENT ORDER, AND
CONSENTS TO THE ENTRY OF THE CONSENT
ORDER BY THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS

User Guidance

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE
SUPERVISION OF SALES ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING
THE PERIOD JANUARY 1, 2004 THROUGH
DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC (THE
"FIRM") WITH A MULTISTATE TASK FORCE
COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES
ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"). AS
PART OF THE GLOBAL SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER
CONSENT ORDERS, IN WHICH THE FIRM NEITHER
ADMITS NOR DENIES THE ALLEGATIONS. IN THIS INSTANCE, THE STATE OF
CALIFORNIA DEPARTMENT OF BUSINESS
OVERSIGHT (THE "DEPARTMENT") ALLEGED THAT THE ACCEPTANCE OF
CLIENT ORDERS IN CALIFORNIA THROUGH
SALES ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN CALIFORNIA AND IN
CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE MAINTENANCE OF
BOOKS AND RECORDS PERTAINING TO THE IDENTITY OF SALES
ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS
VIOLATED CALIFORNIA CORPORATE SECURITIES LAW OF 1968 SECTIONS
25210(B), 25217(A) AND 25241, AND
CALIFORNIA CODE OF REGULATIONS, TITLE 10, SECTION 260.218.4.
WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE
ALLEGATIONS, THE FIRM AGREED TO MAKE, AND ALREADY HAS MADE,
CERTAIN REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS
REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER PROCESSES. THE
FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DEPARTMENT A
SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $47,500.00, CALIFORNIA'S ALLOCATED PORTION
OF THE AMOUNT AGREED TO WITH NASAA.
FINALLY, THE DEPARTMENT AND THE FIRM AGREED THAT THE CONSENT
ORDER WOULD NOT SUBJECT THE FIRM TO
ANY DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS, ANY STATE, THE
DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, OR THE
U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY
SECURITIES OR COMMODITIES REGULATORY
OR SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATION, WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE
AGREEMENT WITH NASAA.

REGISTERED IN NEW MEXICO IN VIOLATION OF NMSA SECTION 58-13C604(C) AND NEW MEXICO ADMINISTRATIVE CODE ("NMAC") RULE 12.11.4.10,
AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE FIRM FAILED TO RECORD THE IDENTITY
OF SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN VIOLATION OF
NMAC RULE 12.11.3.8.

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") WITH A MULTISTATE TASK FORCE
COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES
ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"). AS PART OF THE GLOBAL
SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER CONSENT ORDERS, IN
WHICH THE FIRM NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE ALLEGATIONS. IN
THIS INSTANCE, THE NEW MEXICO SECURITIES DIVISION (THE "DIVISION")
ALLEGED THAT THE ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN NEW MEXICO
THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS
THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN NEW MEXICO AND IN CERTAIN
INSTANCES, THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS PERTAINING
TO THE IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN
ORDERS VIOLATED NEW MEXICO UNIFORM SECURITIES ACT SECTIONS
58-13C-401(A) AND 58-13C-604(C) AND NEW MEXICO ADMINISTRATIVE
CODE RULES 12.11.3.8 AND 12.11.4.10. WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING
THE ALLEGATIONS, THE FIRM AGREED TO
MAKE, AND ALREADY HAS MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS
REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER PROCESSES. THE
FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DIVISION A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF
$50,800.00, NEW MEXICO'S ALLOCATED PORTION OF THE AMOUNT
AGREED TO WITH NASAA. FINALLY, THE DIVISION AND THE FIRM
AGREED THAT THE CONSENT ORDER WOULD NOT SUBJECT THE FIRM TO
ANY DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS, ANY STATE, THE
DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR
UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY SECURITIES OR
COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR SELF-REGULATORY
ORGANIZATION, WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE AGREEMENT WITH
NASAA.

www.finra.org/brokercheck

ON JUNE 25, 2014, THE SECURITIES DIVISION ENTERED INTO A CONSENT
ORDER WITH J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC ("RESPONDENT") TO SETTLE
ALLEGATIONS RELATED TO RESPONDENT'S SALES ASSISTANTS
ACCEPTING ORDERS FROM WASHINGTON STATE CLIENTS WHEN THE
SALES ASSISTANTS WERE NOT REGISTERED AS SECURITIES
SALESPERSONS IN THE STATE, AND RESPONDENT'S FAILURE TO RECORD
THE IDENTITY OF THE PERSON ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS. THE
DIVISION ALLEGED THAT RESPONDENT VIOLATED TO THE SECURITIES
ACT OF WASHINGTON BY FAILING TO REASONABLY SUPERVISE ITS
SALESPERSONS IN VIOLATION OF RCW 21.20.110(1)(J), EMPLOYING
UNREGISTERED SALESPERSONS IN VIOLATION OF RCW 21.20.040(2), AND
FAILING TO MAINTAIN PROPER RECORDS IN VIOLATION OF RCW 21.20.
100(1). RESPONDENT NEITHER ADMITTED NOR DENIED THE DIVISION'S
ALLEGATIONS. RESPONDENT AGREED TO PAY A FINE OF $50,000 AND
WAIVED ITS RIGHT TO A HEARING AND JUDICIAL REVIEW OF THE MATTER.

ORDER (NO. CO-14-8151-S) WITH RESPECT TO J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES,

JANUARY 1, 2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011. IN THIS CASE, CERTAIN
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC
SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTED UNSOLICITED SECURITIES ORDERS AT A

327

www.finra.org/brokercheck

ORDER (NO. CO-14-8151-S) WITH RESPECT TO J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES,
LLC, A CONNECTICUT-REGISTERED BROKER-DEALER. THE SETTLEMENT
AROSE FROM A MULTI-STATE INVESTIGATION INTO THE FIRM'S
SUPERVISORY SYSTEM AS IT RELATED TO THE STATE REGISTRATION OF
SALES ASSISTANTS. THE INVESTIGATION COVERED THE PERIOD FROM
JANUARY 1, 2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011. IN THIS CASE, CERTAIN
SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTED UNSOLICITED SECURITIES ORDERS AT A
TIME WHEN THE SALES ASSISTANTS WERE NOT APPROPRIATELY
REGISTERED UNDER THE CONNECTICUT UNIFORM SECURITIES ACT. THE
CONSENT ORDER NOTED THAT THE FIRM HAD SINCE IMPLEMENTED A
NEW TRADING SYSTEM WITH THE ABILITY TO CONFIRM THE
REGISTRATION STATUS OF ORDER ACCEPTORS.

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS

ALLEGED THAT J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") ACCEPTED

J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES
THE FINDINGS OF FACT AND CONCLUSIONS OF LAW CONTAINED IN THE
CONSENT ORDER, AND CONSENTS TO THE ENTRY OF THE CONSENT
ORDER BY THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF BANKING (THE
"DEPARTMENT"). THE FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DEPARTMENT A
SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF $53,800.00, WHICH WAS REMITTED ON OR ABOUT
JUNE 24, 2014.

Firm Statement

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") WITH A MULTISTATE TASK FORCE
COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES
ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"). AS PART OF THE GLOBAL
SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER CONSENT ORDERS, IN
WHICH THE FIRM NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE ALLEGATIONS. IN
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC
THIS INSTANCE, THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF BANKING (THE

329

www.finra.org/brokercheck

2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") WITH A MULTISTATE TASK FORCE
COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES
ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"). AS PART OF THE GLOBAL
SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER CONSENT ORDERS, IN
WHICH THE FIRM NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE ALLEGATIONS. IN
THIS INSTANCE, THE CONNECTICUT DEPARTMENT OF BANKING (THE
"DEPARTMENT") ALLEGED THAT THE ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN
CONNECTICUT THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT
REGISTERED IN CONNECTICUT AND, IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE
MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS PERTAINING TO THE IDENTITY
OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS VIOLATED
CONNECTICUT UNIFORM SECURITIES ACT SECTIONS 36B-6(B) AND 36B14(A)(2) AND REGULATIONS OF CONNECTICUT STATE AGENCIES 36B-316F(B). WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, THE FIRM
AGREED TO MAKE, AND ALREADY HAS MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL
CHANGES TO ITS REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER
PROCESSES. THE FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE DEPARTMENT A SUM
IN THE AMOUNT OF $53,800.00, CONNECTICUT'S ALLOCATED PORTION OF
THE AMOUNT AGREED TO WITH NASAA. FINALLY, THE DEPARTMENT AND
THE FIRM AGREED THAT THE CONSENT ORDER WOULD NOT SUBJECT THE
FIRM TO ANY DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS, ANY
STATE, THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S. VIRGIN
ISLANDS, OR UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY SECURITIES
OR COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATION,
WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE AGREEMENT WITH NASAA.

Disclosure 123 of 331
Reporting Source:

Regulator

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE FINDINGS, THE FIRM CONSENTED
TO THE SANCTIONS AND TO THE ENTRY OF FINDINGS THAT IT FAILED TO
REPORT THE CORRECT RELATED MARKET CENTER INDICATOR FOR NONTAPE REPORTS TO THE FINRA/NASDAQ TRADE REPORTING FACILITY IN
TRANSACTIONS IN DESIGNATED SECURITIES. THE FINDINGS STATED THAT
THE FIRM TRANSMITTED REPORTS TO THE ORDER AUDIT TRAIL SYSTEM
(OATS) THAT CONTAINED INACCURATE EXECUTION CODES AND
INCOMPLETE AND INACCURATE EXECUTION REPORTS. THE FIRM MADE
AVAILABLE A REPORT ON THE COVERED ORDERS IN NATIONAL MARKET
SYSTEM SECURITIES THAT IT RECEIVED FOR EXECUTION FROM ANY
PERSON. BECAUSE THE FIRM IMPROPERLY CLASSIFIED NOT HELD
ORDERS AS COVERED ORDERS, THIS REPORT INCLUDED INCORRECT
INFORMATION AS TO THREE ORDER TYPE/SIZE CATEGORIES.

Disclosure 125 of 331
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

IN CONNECTION WITH COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS BY A MULTISTATE
TASK FORCE WITH NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES ADMINISTRATORS
ASSOCIATION INC., THE TEXAS STATE SECURITIES BOARD ALLEGED THAT
J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") ACCEPTED CLIENT ORDERS
THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS WHO WERE NOT REGISTERED IN TEXAS,
THE FIRM FAILED TO MONITOR THE REGISTRATION STATUS OF THESE
SALES ASSISTANTS AND ENFORCE ITS SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES TO
ENSURE THAT THESE PERSONS WERE REGISTERED IN TEXAS IN
VIOLATION OF SECTIONS 115.10(A) AND 115.10(B)(1) OF THE RULES AND
REGULATIONS OF THE TEXAS STATE SECURITIES BOARD ("BOARD
RULES"), AND IN CERTAIN INSTANCES, THE FIRM FAILED TO RECORD THE
IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS ACCEPTING CLIENT ORDERS IN
VIOLATION OF SECTION 115.5(B)(6)(A) OF THE BOARD RULES.

Sanction Details:

J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES
THE FINDINGS OF FACT AND CONCLUSIONS OF LAW CONTAINED IN THE
CONSENT ORDER, AND CONSENTS TO THE ENTRY OF THE CONSENT
ORDER BY THE TEXAS STATE SECURITIES BOARD (THE "BOARD"). THE
FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE BOARD A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF
$74,355.00, WHICH WAS REMITTED ON OR ABOUT MAY 8, 2014.

Firm Statement

THIS ACTION IS PART OF A GLOBAL SETTLEMENT REGARDING THE
ACTIVITIES OF SALES ASSISTANTS AND THE SUPERVISION OF SALES
ASSISTANTS' REGISTRATION STATUS DURING THE PERIOD JANUARY 1,
2004 THROUGH DECEMBER 31, 2011 REACHED BY J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES, LLC (THE "FIRM") WITH A MULTISTATE TASK FORCE
COMPOSED OF MEMBERS OF THE NORTH AMERICAN SECURITIES
ADMINISTRATORS ASSOCIATION INC. ("NASAA"). AS PART OF THE GLOBAL
SETTLEMENT, INDIVIDUAL STATES MAY ENTER CONSENT ORDERS, IN
WHICH THE FIRM NEITHER ADMITS NOR DENIES THE ALLEGATIONS. IN
THIS INSTANCE, THE TEXAS STATE SECURITIES BOARD (THE "BOARD")
ALLEGED THAT THE ACCEPTANCE OF CLIENT ORDERS IN TEXAS
THROUGH SALES ASSISTANTS THAT WERE NOT REGISTERED IN TEXAS
AND THE MAINTENANCE OF BOOKS AND RECORDS PERTAINING TO THE
IDENTITY OF SALES ASSISTANTS WHO ACCEPTED CERTAIN ORDERS
VIOLATED SECTIONS 115.10(A), 115.10(B)(1) AND 115.5(B)(6)(A) OF THE
RULES AND REGULATIONS OF THE TEXAS STATE SECURITIES BOARD.
WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, THE FIRM AGREED
TO MAKE, AND ALREADY HAS MADE, CERTAIN REMEDIAL CHANGES TO ITS
REGISTRATION POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND OTHER PROCESSES. THE
FIRM ALSO AGREED TO PAY THE BOARD A SUM IN THE AMOUNT OF
$74,355.00, TEXAS' ALLOCATED PORTION OF THE AMOUNT AGREED TO
WITH NASAA. FINALLY, THE BOARD AND THE FIRM AGREED THAT THE
CONSENT ORDER WOULD NOT SUBJECT THE FIRM TO ANY
DISQUALIFICATIONS UNDER THE FEDERAL LAWS, ANY STATE, THE
DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, PUERTO RICO, OR THE U.S. VIRGIN ISLANDS, OR
UNDER THE RULES OR REGULATIONS OF ANY SECURITIES OR
COMMODITIES REGULATORY OR SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATION,

WHICH WAS ALSO PART OF THE AGREEMENT WITH NASAA.
