Disclosure 237 of 331
Reporting Source:

Regulator

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved.

NASD RULE 2110 - RESPONDENT MEMBER WAS THE LEAD MANAGER FOR
IN THE IMMEDIATE AFTERMARKET AT AN
INCREASE OVER THE INITIAL OFFERING PRICE SO THAT PUBLIC

EIGHT
IPOS
THAT TRADED
Report about
J.P. HOT
MORGAN
SECURITIES
LLC

549

www.finra.org/brokercheck

User Guidance

Allegations:

NASD RULE 2110 - RESPONDENT MEMBER WAS THE LEAD MANAGER FOR
EIGHT HOT IPOS THAT TRADED IN THE IMMEDIATE AFTERMARKET AT AN
INCREASE OVER THE INITIAL OFFERING PRICE SO THAT PUBLIC
CUSTOMERS WHO OBTAINED IPO SHARES FROM THE FIRM STOOD TO
MAKE SIGNIFICANT PROFITS BY SELLING THE SHARES IN THE
AFTERMARKET; THE FIRM ALLOCATED TO ITS OWN CUSTOMERS,
PRIMARILY TO ITS INSTITUTIONAL ACCOUNTS, THE VAST MAJORITY OF
SHARES IN EACH OF THE IPOS IN WHICH THE FIRM ACTED AS THE LEAD
MANAGER; THE FIRM RECEIVED $4.5 MILLION IN UNUSUALLY HIGH
BROKERAGE COMMISSIONS TO EXECUTE INSTITUTIONAL SIZED TRADES
IN LIQUID LISTED SECURITIES AND MADE NO FURTHER INQUIRY
ALTHOUGH THE COMMISSIONS WERE PAID WITHIN ONE DAY OF THE
CUSTOMERS RECEIVING AN ALLOCATION IN A HOT IPO FROM THE FIRM
AND THE FIRM WAS NOT PROVIDING UNUSUAL OR EXTRAORDINARY
SERVICES TO THE CUSTOMERS.

WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, BEAR STEARNS &
CO., INC. CONSENTED TO THE DESCRIBED SANCTIONS AND TO THE

Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

THE NASD ALLEGED VIOLATIONS OF NASD CONDUCT RULE 2110 IN
CONNECTION WITH THE RECEIPT DURING OCTOBER 1999 TO FEBRUARY
2000 OF HIGHER-THAN-NORMAL COMMISSIONS FROM A SMALL NUMBER
OF CUSTOMERS. IT WAS ALLEGED THAT BEAR STEARNS FAILED TO
OBSERVE HIGH STANDARDS OF COMMERCIAL HONOR BY ACCEPTING THE
COMMISSIONS WITHOUT FURTHER INQUIRY AND WITHIN ONE DAY OF
ALLOCATING SHARES TO THOSE SAME CUSTOMERS OF "HOT" INITIAL
PUBLIC OFFERINGS.

FINDINGS OR CONCLUSIONS OF VARIOUS FEDERAL AND STATE
REGULATORS AND SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATIONS, APPLICANT

NYSE, THE NASD, AND VARIOUS STATE REGULATORS TO RESOLVE THEIR
INVESTIGATIONS OF APPLICANT RELATING TO THE ALLEGED CONFLICT

ON THE ALLOCATION OF SHARES IN INITIAL PUBLIC OFFERINGS TO

OTHER SAFEGUARDS TO ENSURE FURTHER THE INTEGRITY OF
APPLICANT'S INVESTMENT RESEARCH; AND (3) PERMANENTLY
RESTRAINED AND ENJOINED APPLICANT FROM VIOLATING NYSE 342, 401,
472, 476(A)(6) AND NASD RULES 2110, 2210 AND 3010 RELATING TO
INVESTMENT RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. ANY MONETARY PENALTIES AND
OTHER PAYMENTS REQUIRED BY SUCH ARRANGEMENTS ARE EXPECTED
TO BE INCLUDED WITHIN THE AGGREGATE AMOUNT DISCUSSED IN
QUESTION 12C. ABOVE.

Sanction Details:

UNDER THE TERMS OF A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED WITH THE STATE OF
PENNSYLVANIA, THE APPLICANT CONSENTED TO PAY A MONETARY
PENALTY OF $946,269 TO THE STATE OF PENNSYLVANIA AND ALSO
CONSENTED TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM VIOLATIONS OF PENNSYLVANIA
SECURITIES ACT OF 1972 . THE APPLICANT ALSO CONSENTED TO THE
TERMS OF THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT" ENTERED INTO BY MANY OF THE
LEADING U.S. SECURITIES FIRMS.
THE "GLOBAL" SETTLEMENT INVOLVES PAYMENT BY APPLICANT OF A
TOTAL AMOUNT OF $80 MILLION: (1) $25 MILLION AS A PENALTY; (2) $25
MILLION AS DISGORGEMENT TO A DISTRIBUTION FUND FOR THE BENEFIT
OF CERTAIN CUSTOMERS; (3) $25 MILLION TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT
THIRD-PARTY RESEARCH OVER FIVE YEARS FOR CLIENTS; AND (4) $5
MILLION OVER FIVE YEARS FOR INVESTOR EDUCATION. THIS $80 MILLION
FIGURE IS AN AGGREGATE AMOUNT THAT ENCOMPASSES THE
SETTLEMENT WITH THE SEC, NYSE, NASD AND THE VARIOUS STATES.
THESE AMOUNTS WILL BE PAID AS PRESCRIBED IN SEC LITIGATION
RELEASE NO. 18438 AND IN THE FINAL JUDGMENT (THE "FINAL
JUDGMENT") ENTERED BY THE DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN
DISTRICT OF NEW YORK IN NO. 03 CIV. 2937 (WHP) ON OCTOBER 31, 2003.

ON APRIL 28, 2003, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS,
FINDINGS OR CONCLUSIONS OF VARIOUS FEDERAL AND STATE
REGULATORS AND SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATIONS, APPLICANT
CONSENTED TO A FINAL "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT". UNDER THE TERMS OF
THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT ENTERED INTO CONSENT
AGREEMENTS AND OTHER DEFINITIVE DOCUMENTS WITH THE SEC, THE
NYSE, THE NASD, AND VARIOUS STATE REGULATORS TO RESOLVE THEIR
INVESTIGATIONS OF APPLICANT RELATING TO THE ALLEGED CONFLICT
BETWEEN EQUITY RESEARCH AND INVESTMENT BANKING. APPLICANT
ALSO CONSENTED TO A VOLUNTARY INITIATIVE IMPOSING RESTRICTIONS
ON THE ALLOCATION OF SHARES IN INITIAL PUBLIC OFFERINGS TO
EXECUTIVES AND DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC COMPANIES.
PURSUANT TO THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT CONSENTED TO
THE ENTRY OF THE FINAL JUDGMENT ENTERED ON OCTOBER 31, 2003.
THE FINAL JUDGMENT: (1) IMPOSED THE MONETARY SANCTIONS
DESCRIBED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE; (2) REQUIRED APPLICANT TO
ADOPT VARIOUS ADDITIONAL POLICIES, SYSTEMS, PROCEDURES AND
OTHER SAFEGUARDS TO ENSURE FURTHER THE INTEGRITY OF
APPLICANT'S INVESTMENT RESEARCH; AND (3) PERMANENTLY
RESTRAINED AND ENJOINED APPLICANT FROM VIOLATING NYSE 342, 401,
472, 476(A)(6) AND NASD RULES 2110, 2210 AND 3010 RELATING TO
INVESTMENT RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. ANY MONETARY PENALTIES AND
OTHER PAYMENTS REQUIRED BY SUCH ARRANGEMENTS ARE EXPECTED
TO BE INCLUDED WITHIN THE AGGREGATE AMOUNT DISCUSSED IN
QUESTION 12C. ABOVE.

Allegations:

THIS PROCEEDING AROSE OUT OF A JOINT INVESTIGATION BY THE
SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION ("SEC"), THE NEW YORK
STOCK EXCHANGE ("NYSE"), THE NASD REGULATION, INC. ("NASD") AND
VARIOUS STATE REGULATORY AGENCIES INTO ALLEGED CONFLICTS OF
INTEREST BETWEEN THE APPLICANT'S EQUITY RESEARCH DEPARTMENT
AND ITS INVESTMENT BANKING DEPARTMENT. THE ENSUING "GLOBAL"
SETTLEMENT INVOLVED THE APPLICANT AND NINE OTHER LARGE
SECURITIES FIRMS.

STATE OF IOWA - IOWA SECURITIES BUREAU (AS PART OF A MULTIREGULATORY SETTLEMENT

Order

Resolution Date:

02/11/2004

Sanctions Ordered:

Monetary/Fine $25,000,000.00
Cease and Desist/Injunction

Other Sanctions Ordered:

PAYMENT TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT RESEARCH; PAYMENT FOR
INVESTOR EDUCATION; UNDERTAKING TO ADOPT POLICIES AND
PROCEDURES TO PROMOTE THE INTEGRITY AND INDEPENDENCE OF
RESEARCH.

Sanction Details:

UNDER THE TERMS OF A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED WITH THE STATE OF
IOWA, THE APPLICANT CONSENTED TO PAY A MONETARY PENALTY OF
$250,000 TO THE STATE OF IOWA AND ALSO CONSENTED TO CEASE AND
DESIST FROM VIOLATIONS OF IOWA CODE §§ 502.304 (1)(G) & (J). THE
APPLICANT ALSO CONSENTED TO THE TERMS OF THE "GLOBAL
SETTLEMENT" ENTERED INTO BY MANY OF THE LEADING U.S. SECURITIES
FIRMS.
THE "GLOBAL" SETTLEMENT INVOLVES PAYMENT BY APPLICANT OF A
TOTAL AMOUNT OF $80 MILLION: (1) $25 MILLION AS A PENALTY; (2) $25
MILLION AS DISGORGEMENT TO A DISTRIBUTION FUND FOR THE BENEFIT
OF CERTAIN CUSTOMERS; (3) $25 MILLION TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT
THIRD-PARTY RESEARCH OVER FIVE YEARS FOR CLIENTS; AND (4) $5
MILLION OVER FIVE YEARS FOR INVESTOR EDUCATION. THIS $80 MILLION
FIGURE IS AN AGGREGATE AMOUNT THAT ENCOMPASSES THE
SETTLEMENT WITH THE SEC, NYSE, NASD AND THE VARIOUS STATES.
THESE AMOUNTS WILL BE PAID AS PRESCRIBED IN SEC LITIGATION
RELEASE NO. 18438 AND IN THE FINAL JUDGMENT (THE "FINAL
JUDGMENT") ENTERED BY THE DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN
DISTRICT OF NEW YORK IN NO. 03 CIV. 2937 (WHP) ON OCTOBER 31, 2003.

Firm Statement

UNDER THE TERMS OF A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED WITH THE STATE OF
IOWA, THE APPLICANT CONSENTED TO PAY A MONETARY PENALTY OF

J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES
LLCIOWA AND ALSO CONSENTED TO CEASE AND

UNDER THE TERMS OF A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED WITH THE STATE OF
IOWA, THE APPLICANT CONSENTED TO PAY A MONETARY PENALTY OF
$250,000 TO THE STATE OF IOWA AND ALSO CONSENTED TO CEASE AND
DESIST FROM VIOLATIONS OF IOWA CODE §§ 502.304(1)(G)& (J).
ON APRIL 28, 2003, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS,
FINDINGS OR CONCLUSIONS OF VARIOUS FEDERAL AND STATE
REGULATORS AND SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATIONS, APPLICANT
CONSENTED TO A FINAL "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT". UNDER THE TERMS OF
THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT ENTERED INTO CONSENT
AGREEMENTS AND OTHER DEFINITIVE DOCUMENTS WITH THE SEC, THE
NYSE, THE NASD, AND VARIOUS STATE REGULATORS TO RESOLVE THEIR
INVESTIGATIONS OF APPLICANT RELATING TO THE ALLEGED CONFLICT
BETWEEN EQUITY RESEARCH AND INVESTMENT BANKING. APPLICANT
ALSO CONSENTED TO A VOLUNTARY INITIATIVE IMPOSING RESTRICTIONS
ON THE ALLOCATION OF SHARES IN INITIAL PUBLIC OFFERINGS TO
EXECUTIVES AND DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC COMPANIES.
PURSUANT TO THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT CONSENTED TO
THE ENTRY OF THE FINAL JUDGMENT ENTERED ON OCTOBER 31, 2003.
THE FINAL JUDGMENT: (1) IMPOSED THE MONETARY SANCTIONS
DESCRIBED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE; (2) REQUIRED APPLICANT TO
ADOPT VARIOUS ADDITIONAL POLICIES, SYSTEMS, PROCEDURES AND
OTHER SAFEGUARDS TO ENSURE FURTHER THE INTEGRITY OF
APPLICANT'S INVESTMENT RESEARCH; AND (3) PERMANENTLY
RESTRAINED AND ENJOINED APPLICANT FROM VIOLATING NYSE 342, 401,
472, 476(A)(6) AND NASD RULES 2110, 2210 AND 3010 RELATING TO
INVESTMENT RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. ANY MONETARY PENALTIES AND
OTHER PAYMENTS REQUIRED BY SUCH ARRANGEMENTS ARE EXPECTED
TO BE INCLUDED WITHIN THE AGGREGATE AMOUNT DISCUSSED IN
QUESTION 12C. ABOVE.

Reporting Source:

Regulator

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

NASD RULE 2110 - RESPONDENT MEMBER SOLD SHARES ISSUED BY
MUTUAL FUNDS WITHOUT PROVIDING CERTAIN CUSTOMERS WITH
BREAKPOINT DISCOUNTS DESCRIBED IN THE PROSPECTUSES OF THE
FUND; FAILED TO GIVE ITS CUSTOMERS BREAKPOINT DISCOUNTS IN 52%
OF ELIGIBLE MUTUAL FUND TRANSACTIONS IN 2001 AND 2002 THAT
RESULTED IN MISSED BREAKPOINTS THAT WOULD HAVE REDUCED
CUSTOMERS' CHARGES BY AT LEAST $280,469 ON THEIR PURCHASES OF
MUTUAL FUND SHARES WITH FRONT-END LOADS DURING THE RELEVANT
PERIOD.

Sanction Details:

WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, BEAR, STEARNS &
CO., INC. CONSENTED TO THE DESCRIBED SANCTIONS AND TO THE
ENTRY OF FINDINGS, THEREFORE, THE FIRM IS CENSURED, FINED

CUSTOMER WHO PURCHASED FRONT-END LOAD MUTUAL FUNDS
THROUGH THE FIRM FROM JANUARY 1, 1999 THROUGH NOVEMBER 3,
2003 THAT THE FIRM EXPERIENCED A PROBLEM DELIVERING BREAKPOINT
DISCOUNTS AND THAT AS A RESULT, THE CUSTOMER MAY BE ENTITLED TO
A REFUND; PERFORM A TRADE-BY-TRADE ANALYSIS OF ALL FRONT-END
LOAD MUTUAL FUND PURCHASES OF $2,500 OR MORE AND ALL
OVERCHARGES IDENTIFIED REFUNDED BY MARCH 31, 2004; PROVIDE
REFUNDS TO ALL CUSTOMERS WHO DID NOT RECEIVE ALL APPLICABLE
BREAKPOINT DISCOUNTS AS DESCRIBED IN NTM 03-47; PROVIDE NASD A
REPORT ON RESPONDENT'S PROGRAM BY 4/16/04; AND NOT LATER THAN
SIX MONTHS AFTER THE DATE OF THIS ORDER, RESPONDENT'S CHIEF
EXECUTIVE OFFICER OR ANOTHER SENIOR EXECUTIVE OFFICER SHALL
CERTIFY IN WRITING TO NASD THAT RESPONDENT HAS IMPLEMENTED
PROCEDURES AND A SYSTEM FOR IDENTIFYING SUCH PROCEDURES
THAT CAN REASONABLY BE EXPECTED TO PREVENT AND DETECT

WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGED VIOLATIONS RELATED
TO THE FAILURE TO DELIVER PROPER BREAKPOINT DISCOUNTS TO
CUSTOMERS WHO PURCHASED FRONT-END LOAD SHARES OF MUTUAL
FUNDS, BEAR, STEARNS & CO. INC. (THE "FIRM") CONSENTED TO (1) A
CENSURE, (2) A FINE IN THE AMOUNT OF $280,469, AND (3) AGREED TO
CERTAIN UNDERTAKINGS. THE UNDERTAKINGS, WHICH MUST BE
COMPLETED BY SPECIFIED TIMES UNLESS EXTENDED BY THE NASD,
REQUIRE, AMONG OTHER THINGS, THAT THE FIRM: (A) PROVIDE WRITTEN
NOTIFICATION WITH A CLAIM FORM TO EACH CUSTOMER WHO
PURCHASED FRONT-END LOAD MUTUAL FUNDS THROUGH THE FIRM
FROM 01/01/99 THROUGH 11/03/03, STATING THAT THE FIRM EXPERIENCED
A PROBLEM DELIVERING BREAKPOINT DISCOUNTS AND THAT AS A
RESULT, THE CUSTOMER MAY BE ENTITLED TO A REFUND; (B) REVIEW ITS
RECORDS AND ANY OTHER AVAILABLE INFORMATION, FOR CUSTOMERS
WHO RESPOND TO THE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION, TO DETERMINE
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about
J.P. MORGAN
LLCIS ENTITLED TO A REFUND AND TO DETERMINE
WHETHER
THESECURITIES
CUSTOMER
THE AMOUNT OF THE REFUND; (C) PERFORM A TRADE-BY-TRADE

562

PURCHASED FRONT-END LOAD MUTUAL FUNDS THROUGH THE FIRM
FROM 01/01/99 THROUGH 11/03/03, STATING THAT THE FIRM EXPERIENCED
A PROBLEM DELIVERING BREAKPOINT DISCOUNTS AND THAT AS A
RESULT, THE CUSTOMER MAY BE ENTITLED TO A REFUND; (B) REVIEW ITS
RECORDS AND ANY OTHER AVAILABLE INFORMATION, FOR CUSTOMERS
WHO RESPOND TO THE WRITTEN NOTIFICATION, TO DETERMINE
WHETHER THE CUSTOMER IS ENTITLED TO A REFUND AND TO DETERMINE
THE AMOUNT OF THE REFUND; (C) PERFORM A TRADE-BY-TRADE
ANALYSIS OF ALL FRONT-END LOAD MUTUAL FUND PURCHASES OF $2,500
OR MORE FROM 01/01/01 THROUGH 11/03/03 AND REVIEW ALL OTHER
PURCHASES BY EACH CUSTOMER WHO HAD SUCH A PURCHASE,
REGARDLESS OF DOLLAR AMOUNT, DURING THE PERIOD 01/01/01
THROUGH 11/03/03, AND UNDERTAKE VIGOROUS EFFORTS TO LOCATE
EACH CUSTOMER IDENTIFIED AS ENTITLED TO A REFUND; (D) PROVIDE
REFUNDS TO ALL CUSTOMERS WHO DID NOT RECEIVE ALL APPLICABLE
BREAKPOINT DISCOUNTS, AS DESCRIBED IN NASD NOTICE TO MEMBERS
03-47; (E) PROVIDE TO THE NASD A REPORT ON THE FIRM'S REFUND
PROGRAM, WHICH REPORT SHALL INCLUDE (I) A DESCRIPTION OF THE
EFFORTS MADE TO LOCATE CUSTOMERS ENTITLED TO A REFUND, (II) THE
RESULTS OF THE REFUND PROGRAM; AND (F) PROVIDE, NOT LATER THAN
SIX MONTHS AFTER THE DATE OF THE LETTER, A CERTIFICATION THAT
THE FIRM HAS IMPLEMENTED PROCEDURES AND SYSTEMS THAT CAN
REASONABLY BE EXPECTED BY PREVENT AND DETECT FAILURE TO
PROVIDE APPROPRIATE BREAKPOINTS BY THE FIRM TO ELIGIBLE
CUSTOMERS. (CONTINUED IN ITEM 13.)

OF THE LEADING U.S. SECURITIES FIRMS.

MILLION AS DISGORGEMENT TO A DISTRIBUTION FUND FOR THE BENEFIT

THIRD-PARTY RESEARCH OVER FIVE YEARS FOR CLIENTS; AND (4) $5
MILLION OVER FIVE YEARS FOR INVESTOR EDUCATION. THIS $80 MILLION
FIGURE IS AN AGGREGATE AMOUNT THAT ENCOMPASSES THE
SETTLEMENT WITH THE SEC, NYSE, NASD AND THE VARIOUS STATES.
THESE AMOUNTS WILL BE PAID AS PRESCRIBED IN SEC LITIGATION
RELEASE NO. 18438 AND IN THE FINAL JUDGMENT (THE "FINAL
JUDGMENT") ENTERED BY THE DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN
DISTRICT OF NEW YORK IN NO. 03 CIV. 2937 (WHP) ON OCTOBER 31, 2003.

DESCRIBED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE; (2) REQUIRED APPLICANT TO
ADOPT VARIOUS ADDITIONAL POLICIES, SYSTEMS, PROCEDURES AND
OTHER SAFEGUARDS TO ENSURE FURTHER THE INTEGRITY OF
APPLICANT'S INVESTMENT RESEARCH; AND (3) PERMANENTLY
RESTRAINED AND ENJOINED APPLICANT FROM VIOLATING NYSE 342, 401,
472, 476(A)(6) AND NASD RULES 2110, 2210 AND 3010 RELATING TO
INVESTMENT RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. ANY MONETARY PENALTIES AND
OTHER PAYMENTS REQUIRED BY SUCH ARRANGEMENTS ARE EXPECTED
TO BE INCLUDED WITHIN THE AGGREGATE AMOUNT DISCUSSED IN
QUESTION 12C. ABOVE.

i
Disclosure 243 of 331
Reporting Source:

Regulator

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

THE RESPONDENT SETTLED ALLEGATIONS THAT UNDUE INFLUENCE BY
THE INVESTMENT BANKING DIVISION ON SECURITIES RESEARCH AT THE
FIRM RESULTED IN TAINTED RESEARCH.

UNDER THE TERMS OF A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED WITH THE STATE OF
GEORGIA, THE APPLICANT CONSENTED TO PAY A MONETARY PENALTY OF
$630,775 TO THE STATE OF GEORGIA AND ALSO CONSENTED TO CEASE
AND DESIST FROM VIOLATIONS OF O.C.G.A. §§ 10-5-4 (A)(8) AND (11), 10-512(A)(1) AND RULES 590-4-2.-08(1) AND 590-4-2-.14(1) OF THE STATE'S
SECURITIES LAW. THE APPLICANT ALSO CONSENTED TO THE TERMS OF
THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT" ENTERED INTO BY MANY OF THE LEADING
U.S. SECURITIES FIRMS.
THE "GLOBAL" SETTLEMENT INVOLVES PAYMENT BY APPLICANT OF A
TOTAL AMOUNT OF $80 MILLION: (1) $25 MILLION AS A PENALTY; (2) $25
MILLION AS DISGORGEMENT TO A DISTRIBUTION FUND FOR THE BENEFIT
OF CERTAIN CUSTOMERS; (3) $25 MILLION TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT
THIRD-PARTY RESEARCH OVER FIVE YEARS FOR CLIENTS; AND (4) $5
MILLION OVER FIVE YEARS FOR INVESTOR EDUCATION. THIS $80 MILLION
FIGURE IS AN AGGREGATE AMOUNT THAT ENCOMPASSES THE
SETTLEMENT WITH THE SEC, NYSE, NASD AND THE VARIOUS STATES.
THESE AMOUNTS WILL BE PAID AS PRESCRIBED IN SEC LITIGATION
RELEASE NO. 18438 AND IN THE FINAL JUDGMENT (THE "FINAL
JUDGMENT") ENTERED BY THE DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN
DISTRICT OF NEW YORK IN NO. 03 CIV. 2937 (WHP) ON OCTOBER 31, 2003.

UNDER THE TERMS OF A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED WITH THE STATE OF

ON APRIL 28, 2003, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS,
FINDINGS OR CONCLUSIONS OF VARIOUS FEDERAL AND STATE
REGULATORS AND SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATIONS, APPLICANT
CONSENTED TO A FINAL "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT". UNDER THE TERMS OF
THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT ENTERED INTO CONSENT
AGREEMENTS AND OTHER DEFINITIVE DOCUMENTS WITH THE SEC, THE
NYSE, THE NASD, AND VARIOUS STATE REGULATORS TO RESOLVE THEIR
INVESTIGATIONS OF APPLICANT RELATING TO THE ALLEGED CONFLICT
BETWEEN EQUITY RESEARCH AND INVESTMENT BANKING. APPLICANT
ALSO CONSENTED TO A VOLUNTARY INITIATIVE IMPOSING RESTRICTIONS
ON THE ALLOCATION OF SHARES IN INITIAL PUBLIC OFFERINGS TO
EXECUTIVES AND DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC COMPANIES.
PURSUANT TO THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT CONSENTED TO
THE ENTRY OF THE FINAL JUDGMENT ENTERED ON OCTOBER 31, 2003.
THE FINAL JUDGMENT: (1) IMPOSED THE MONETARY SANCTIONS
DESCRIBED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE; (2) REQUIRED APPLICANT TO

OTHER SAFEGUARDS TO ENSURE FURTHER THE INTEGRITY OF
APPLICANT'S INVESTMENT RESEARCH; AND (3) PERMANENTLY

i
Disclosure 246 of 331
Reporting Source:

Regulator

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

NASD CONDUCT RULES 2110 AND 3010 - RESPONDENT MEMBER ("FIRM")
FAILED TO ADEQUATELY AND PROPERLY SUPERVISE A GENERAL
SECURITIES REPRESENTATIVE WITH RESPECT TO THE SEPARATE
ACCOUNTS OF PUBLIC CUSTOMERS THAT APPEARED ON THE CUSTOMER
STATEMENT EXCEPTION REPORT, OR OTHERWISE TAKE STEPS
REASONABLY DESIGNED TO PREVENT UNSUITABLE AND EXCESSIVE
TRADING IN THOSE ACCOUNTS. AFTER THE CUSTOMER'S ACCOUNT
APPEARED ON A MONTHLY SUPERVISION EXCEPTION REPORT, THE FIRM
SENT AN ACTIVITY LETTER THAT WAS SIGNED AND RETURNED TO THE
FIRM. THEREAFTER, CUSTOMER'S ACCOUNT APPEARED ON SIX MONTHLY
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC
TRADING ACTIVITY EXCEPTION REPORTS WITHOUT FURTHER CONTACT

574

www.finra.org/brokercheck

STATEMENT EXCEPTION REPORT, OR OTHERWISE TAKE STEPS
REASONABLY DESIGNED TO PREVENT UNSUITABLE AND EXCESSIVE
TRADING IN THOSE ACCOUNTS. AFTER THE CUSTOMER'S ACCOUNT
APPEARED ON A MONTHLY SUPERVISION EXCEPTION REPORT, THE FIRM
SENT AN ACTIVITY LETTER THAT WAS SIGNED AND RETURNED TO THE
FIRM. THEREAFTER, CUSTOMER'S ACCOUNT APPEARED ON SIX MONTHLY
TRADING ACTIVITY EXCEPTION REPORTS WITHOUT FURTHER CONTACT
FROM ANYONE AT FIRM, EXCEPT THE GENERAL SECURITIES
REPRESENTATIVE. THE CUSTOMER'S ACCOUNT APPEARED THREE TIMES
ON THE FIRM'S ACCOUNT ACTIVITY REPORTS, BUT AN ACTIVITY LETTER
WAS NOT SENT TO THE CUSTOMER IN TIME. DURING THAT TIME, NO ONE
FROM THE FIRM, EXCEPT THE GENERAL SECURITIES REPRESENTATIVE,
HAD ANY CONTACT WITH THE CUSTOMER REGARDING THE TRADING IN
HIS ACCOUNT. THE CUSTOMER REFUSED TO SIGN THE ACTIVITY LETTER.
UPON LEARNING OF CUSTOMER'S REFUSAL TO SIGN THE ACTIVITY
LETTER, THE FIRM DIRECTED THE GENERAL SECURITIES
REPRESENTATIVE TO CEASE TRADING IN CUSTOMERS' ACCOUNTS.
NOTHWITHSTANDING THE DIRECTION TO GENERAL SECURITIES
REPRESENTATIVE TO CEASE TRADING, HE SUBSEQUENTLY PLACED
ADDITIONAL TRADES IN CUSTOMERS' ACCOUNTS. FURTHERMORE, THE
FIRM'S WRITTEN SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES DID NOT REQUIRE ANY
ADDITIONAL CONTACT WITH THE CUSTOMER IF THE ACCOUNT
REPEATEDLY APPEARS ON THE ACTIVITY EXCEPTION REPORT AFTER THE
CUSTOMER SIGNS AND RETURNS AN ACTIVITY LETTER. THE FIRM FAILED
TO ESTABLISH, MAINTAIN, AND ENFORCE WRITTEN SUPERVISORY
PROCEDURES IN THAT ITS PROCEDURES DID NOT REQUIRE SPECIFIC
STEPS TO TAKE WHEN A CUSTOMER ACCOUNT REPEATEDLY APPEARS ON
ACTIVE ACCOUNT EXCEPTION REPORTS SUBSEQUENT TO THE RECEIPT
OF THE CUSTOMER'S SIGNED ACTIVITY LETTER.

Initiated By:

NASD

Date Initiated:

12/15/2003

Docket/Case Number:

C8A030094

Principal Product Type:

Other

Other Product Type(s):

UNKNOWN TYPE OF SECURITIES

User Guidance

Principal Sanction(s)/Relief
Sought:
Other Sanction(s)/Relief
Sought:
Resolution:

Acceptance, Waiver & Consent(AWC)

Resolution Date:

12/15/2003

Does the order constitute a

Does the order constitute a
final order based on
violations of any laws or
regulations that prohibit
fraudulent, manipulative, or
deceptive conduct?
Sanctions Ordered:

No

Other Sanctions Ordered:

UNDERTAKING

Sanction Details:

WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, RESPONDENT FIRM
CONSENTED TO THE DESCRIBED SANCTIONS AND TO THE ENTRY OF
FINDINGS; THEREFORE, FIRM IS CENSURED, FINED $10,000, AND
REQUIRED TO UNDERTAKE WITHIN 60 DAYS OF ACCEPTANCE OF THIS
AWC BY NASD, PROVIDE PROOF OF PAYMENT OF $310,000 TO THE
CUSTOMERS TO RESOLVE THE ARBITRATION CLAIM BROUGHT BY
CUSTOMERS AGAINST IT AND REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVE.
FURTHERMORE, RESPONDENT FIRM IS REQUIRED TO UNDERTAKE WITHIN
60 DAYS TO REVISE ITS WRITTEN SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES WHICH
ARE REASONABLY DESIGNED TO ACHIEVE COMPLIANCE WITH THE
CURRENT REQUIREMENTS OF SUPERVISING ITS REGISTERED
REPRESENTATIVES, REVIEWING CUSTOMER ACCOUNT ACTIVITY AND
TAKING STEPS REASONABLY DESIGNED TO PREVENT UNSITABLE AND
EXCESSIVE TRADING, AS REQUIRED BY NASD CONDUCT RULE 3010. SUCH
WRITTEN PROCEDURES SHALL DESCRIBE THE STEPS TO BE TAKEN TO
ADDRESS A CUSTOMER ACCOUNT THAT REPEATEDLY APPEARS ON
TRADING EXCEPTION, MONITORING AND SUPERVISORY REPORTS AND
THE FOLLOW-UP CONTACT WITH THE CUSTOMER THAT SHOULD BE MADE
BY THE RESPONSIBLE INDIVIDUAL.

Censure
Monetary/Fine $10,000.00

Sought:
Resolution:

Acceptance, Waiver & Consent(AWC)

Resolution Date:

12/15/2003

Sanctions Ordered:

Censure
Monetary/Fine $10,000.00

Other Sanctions Ordered:
Sanction Details:

ON NOVEMBER 3, 2003, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGED
ALLEGATIONS, BEAR, STEARNS & CO. INC. CONSENTED TO A CENSURE, A
FINE IN THE AMOUNT OF $10,000, AND AN UNDERTAKING TO PROVIDE
WITHIN 60 DAYS OF ACCEPTANCE OF THIS AWC BY NASD, PROOF OF
PAYMENT OF $310,000 TO CUSTOMERS JT AND TT TO RESOLVE THE
ARBITRATION CLAIM BROUGHT BY CUSTOMERS JT AND TT AGAINST BEAR
STEARNS AND FORMER BROKER, WILLIAM MUKAI; AND TO AMEND AND
PROVIDE TO NASD STAFF, WITHIN 60 DAYS AFTER THE ACCEPTANCE OF
THIS AWC BY NASD, WRITTEN SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES WHICH ARE
REASONABLY DESIGNED TO ACHIEVE COMPLIANCE WITH THE CURRENT
REQUIREMENTS OF SUPERVISING ITS REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVES,
REVIEWING CUSTOMER ACCOUNT ACTIVITY AND TAKING STEPS
REASONABLY DESIGNED TO PREVENT UNSUITABLE AND EXCESSIVE
TRADING, AS REQUIRED BY CONDUCT RULE 3010. SUCH WRITTEN
PROCEDURES SHALL DESCRIBE THE STEPS TO BE TAKEN TO ADDRESS A
CUSTOMER ACCOUNT THAT REPEATEDLY APPEARS ON TRADING
EXCEPTION, MONITORING AND SUPERVISORY REPORTS AND THE
FOLLOW-UP CONTACT WITH THE CUSTOMER THAT SHOULD BE MADE BY
THE RESPONSIBLE INDIVIDUAL. THE NASD ACCEPTED OUR CONSENT ON
DECEMBER 15, 2003.

i
Disclosure 247 of 331
Reporting Source:

Regulator

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

THE FIRM ENGAGED IN UNETHICAL AND DISHONEST CONDUCT BY FAILING
TO ENSURE THAT ANALYSTS WHO ISSUED RESEARCH WERE ADEQUATELY
INSULATED FROM PRESSURES AND INFLUENCES OF COVERED
COMPANIES AND INVESTMENT BANKING. THE FIRM ALSO FAILED TO
REASONABLY SUPERVISE ITS EMPLOYEES IN CONNECTION WITH THE
ISSUANCE OF RESEARCH.

Sanctions Ordered:

No

Monetary/Fine $250,000.00
Cease and Desist/Injunction

Other Sanctions Ordered:
Sanction Details:

PENALTY PAID ON 8/28/2003.

Regulator Statement

THE FIRM WAS ORDERED TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM VIOLATING THE
RMSA IN CONNECTION WITH CERTAIN CONFLICTS OF INTEREST TO WHICH
ITS RESEARCH ANALYSTS WERE SUBJECT AND TO IMPLEMENT CERTAIN
CHANGES WITH RESPECT TO ITS RESEARCH AND BANKING PRACTICES.
THE CONSENT ORDER WAS EXECUTED AS PART OF A GLOBAL
SETTLEMENT OF COORDINATED INVESTIGATIONS ENTERED INTO BY
FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATORS, AND SEVERAL LARGE BROKERDEALERS WHO ENGAGED IN THE RESEARCH PRACTICES AT ISSUE.

i
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

THIS PROCEEDING AROSE OUT OF A JOINT INVESTIGATION BY THE
SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION ("SEC"), THE NEW YORK
STOCK EXCHANGE ("NYSE"), THE NASD REGULATION, INC. ("NASD") AND
VARIOUS
STATE
REGULATORY
AGENCIES INTO ALLEGED CONFLICTS OF

INTEREST BETWEEN THE APPLICANT'S EQUITY RESEARCH DEPARTMENT

User Guidance

THIS PROCEEDING AROSE OUT OF A JOINT INVESTIGATION BY THE
SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION ("SEC"), THE NEW YORK
STOCK EXCHANGE ("NYSE"), THE NASD REGULATION, INC. ("NASD") AND
VARIOUS STATE REGULATORY AGENCIES INTO ALLEGED CONFLICTS OF
INTEREST BETWEEN THE APPLICANT'S EQUITY RESEARCH DEPARTMENT
AND ITS INVESTMENT BANKING DEPARTMENT. THE ENSUING "GLOBAL"
SETTLEMENT INVOLVED THE APPLICANT AND NINE OTHER LARGE
SECURITIES FIRMS.
Initiated By:

STATE OF MAINE – OFFICE OF SECURITIES (AS PART OF A MULTIREGULATOR SETTLEMENT)

Civil and Administrative Penalt(ies) /Fine(s)

CEASE AND DESIST; PAYMENT TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT RESEARCH;

Resolution:

Order

Resolution Date:

08/28/2003

Sanctions Ordered:

Monetary/Fine $25,000,000.00
Cease and Desist/Injunction

Other Sanctions Ordered:

PAYMENT TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT RESEARCH; PAYMENT FOR
INVESTOR EDUCATION; UNDERTAKING TO ADOPT POLICIES AND
PROCEDURES TO PROMOTE THE INTEGRITY AND INDEPENDENCE OF
RESEARCH.

Sanction Details:

UNDER THE TERMS OF A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED WITH THE STATE OF
MAINE, THE APPLICANT CONSENTED TO PAY A MONETARY PENALTY OF
$250,000 TO THE STATE OF MAINE AND ALSO CONSENTED TO CEASE AND
DESIST FROM VIOLATIONS OF THE RMSA. THE APPLICANT ALSO
CONSENTED TO THE TERMS OF THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT" ENTERED
INTO BY MANY OF THE LEADING U.S. SECURITIES FIRMS.

THE "GLOBAL" SETTLEMENT INVOLVES PAYMENT BY APPLICANT OF A
TOTAL AMOUNT OF $80 MILLION: (1) $25 MILLION AS A PENALTY; (2) $25
MILLION AS DISGORGEMENT TO A DISTRIBUTION FUND FOR THE BENEFIT
OF CERTAIN CUSTOMERS; (3) $25 MILLION TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT
THIRD-PARTY RESEARCH OVER FIVE YEARS FOR CLIENTS; AND (4) $5
MILLION OVER FIVE YEARS FOR INVESTOR EDUCATION. THIS $80 MILLION
FIGURE IS AN AGGREGATE AMOUNT THAT ENCOMPASSES THE
SETTLEMENT
THE SEC,
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about
J.P. MORGANWITH
SECURITIES
LLC NYSE, NASD AND THE VARIOUS STATES.
THESE AMOUNTS WILL BE PAID AS PRESCRIBED IN SEC LITIGATION

579

www.finra.org/brokercheck

Firm Statement

MILLION AS DISGORGEMENT TO A DISTRIBUTION FUND FOR THE BENEFIT
OF CERTAIN CUSTOMERS; (3) $25 MILLION TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT
THIRD-PARTY RESEARCH OVER FIVE YEARS FOR CLIENTS; AND (4) $5
MILLION OVER FIVE YEARS FOR INVESTOR EDUCATION. THIS $80 MILLION
FIGURE IS AN AGGREGATE AMOUNT THAT ENCOMPASSES THE
SETTLEMENT WITH THE SEC, NYSE, NASD AND THE VARIOUS STATES.
THESE AMOUNTS WILL BE PAID AS PRESCRIBED IN SEC LITIGATION

JUDGMENT") ENTERED BY THE DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN
DISTRICT OF NEW YORK IN NO. 03 CIV. 2937 (WHP) ON OCTOBER 31, 2003.

User Guidance

UNDER THE TERMS OF A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED WITH THE STATE OF
MAINE, THE APPLICANT CONSENTED TO PAY A MONETARY PENALTY OF
$250,000 TO THE STATE OF MAINE AND ALSO CONSENTED TO CEASE AND
DESIST FROM VIOLATIONS OF THE RMSA.
ON APRIL 28, 2003, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS,
FINDINGS OR CONCLUSIONS OF VARIOUS FEDERAL AND STATE
REGULATORS AND SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATIONS, APPLICANT
CONSENTED TO A FINAL "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT". UNDER THE TERMS OF
THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT ENTERED INTO CONSENT
AGREEMENTS AND OTHER DEFINITIVE DOCUMENTS WITH THE SEC, THE
NYSE, THE NASD, AND VARIOUS STATE REGULATORS TO RESOLVE THEIR
INVESTIGATIONS OF APPLICANT RELATING TO THE ALLEGED CONFLICT
BETWEEN EQUITY RESEARCH AND INVESTMENT BANKING. APPLICANT
ALSO CONSENTED TO A VOLUNTARY INITIATIVE IMPOSING RESTRICTIONS
ON THE ALLOCATION OF SHARES IN INITIAL PUBLIC OFFERINGS TO
EXECUTIVES AND DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC COMPANIES.
PURSUANT TO THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT CONSENTED TO
THE ENTRY OF THE FINAL JUDGMENT. THE FINAL JUDGMENT: (1) IMPOSED
THE MONETARY SANCTIONS DESCRIBED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE; (2)
REQUIRED APPLICANT TO ADOPT VARIOUS ADDITIONAL POLICIES,
SYSTEMS, PROCEDURES AND OTHER SAFEGUARDS TO ENSURE
FURTHER THE INTEGRITY OF APPLICANT'S INVESTMENT RESEARCH; AND
(3) PERMANENTLY RESTRAINED AND ENJOINED APPLICANT FROM
VIOLATING NYSE 342, 401, 472, 476(A)(6) AND NASD RULES 2110, 2210 AND
3010 RELATING TO INVESTMENT RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. ANY MONETARY
PENALTIES AND OTHER PAYMENTS REQUIRED BY SUCH ARRANGEMENTS
ARE EXPECTED TO BE INCLUDED WITHIN THE AGGREGATE AMOUNT
DISCUSSED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE.

FROM COVERED COMPANIES AND INVESTMENT BANKING. THIS CONDUCT

ENSURE THAT ITS ANALYSTS WHO ISSUED RESEARCH.

User Guidance

Allegations:

BEAR STEARNS & CO., INC. IS CURRENTLY REGISTERED WITH THE TEXAS
STATE SECURITIES BOARD AND HAS BEEN SINCE 7-23-83. BEAR STEARNS
FAILED TO ENSURE THAT ANALYSTS WHO ISSUED RESEARCH WERE
ADEQUATELY INSULATED FROM PRESSUERS & INFLUENCES FROM
COVERED COMPANIES & INVESTMENT BANKING DURING THE RELEVANT
PERIOD, IN VIOLATION OF THE TEXAS SECURITIES ACT. BEAR STEARNS
FAILED TO REASONABLY SUPERVISE ITS EMPLOYEES TO ENSURE THAT
ITS ANALYSTS WHO ISSUED RESEARCH WERE ADEQUATELY INSULATED
FROM PRESSURES & INFLUENCES FROM COVERED COMPANIES &
INVESTMENT BANKING AS REQUIRED BY SECTION 115.10 OF THE BOARD
RULES.

PAYMENT FOR INVESTOR EDUCATION; UNDERTAKING TO ADOPT
ADDITIONAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO PROMOTE INTEGRITY AND
INDEPENDENCE OF RESEARCH.

UNDER THE TERMS OF A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED WITH THE STATE OF
TEXAS, THE APPLICANT CONSENTED TO PAY A MONETARY PENALTY OF
$1,606,657.00 TO THE STATE OF TEXAS AND ALSO CONSENTED TO CEASE

MORGAN
SECURITIES

ANDJ.P.

OF TEXAS SECURITIES ACT AND BOARD
RULE SECTION 115.10. THE APPLICANT ALSO CONSENTED TO THE TERMS

585

www.finra.org/brokercheck

User Guidance

UNDER THE TERMS OF A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED WITH THE STATE OF
TEXAS, THE APPLICANT CONSENTED TO PAY A MONETARY PENALTY OF
$1,606,657.00 TO THE STATE OF TEXAS AND ALSO CONSENTED TO CEASE
AND DESIST FROM VIOLATIONS OF TEXAS SECURITIES ACT AND BOARD
RULE SECTION 115.10. THE APPLICANT ALSO CONSENTED TO THE TERMS
OF THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT" ENTERED INTO BY MANY OF THE LEADING
U.S. SECURITIES FIRMS.
THE "GLOBAL" SETTLEMENT INVOLVES PAYMENT BY APPLICANT OF A
TOTAL AMOUNT OF $80 MILLION: (1) $25 MILLION AS A PENALTY; (2) $25
MILLION AS DISGORGEMENT TO A DISTRIBUTION FUND FOR THE BENEFIT
OF CERTAIN CUSTOMERS; (3) $25 MILLION TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT
THIRD-PARTY RESEARCH OVER FIVE YEARS FOR CLIENTS; AND (4) $5
MILLION OVER FIVE YEARS FOR INVESTOR EDUCATION. THIS $80 MILLION
FIGURE IS AN AGGREGATE AMOUNT THAT ENCOMPASSES THE
SETTLEMENT WITH THE SEC, NYSE, NASD AND THE VARIOUS STATES.
THESE AMOUNTS WILL BE PAID AS PRESCRIBED IN SEC LITIGATION
RELEASE NO. 18438 AND IN THE FINAL JUDGMENT (THE "FINAL
JUDGMENT") ENTERED BY THE DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN
DISTRICT OF NEW YORK IN NO. 03 CIV. 2937 (WHP) ON OCTOBER 31, 2003.
Firm Statement

UNDER THE TERMS OF A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED WITH THE STATE OF
TEXAS ON OCTOBER 17, 2003, THE APPLICANT CONSENTED TO PAY A
MONETARY PENALTY OF $1,606,657.00 TO THE STATE OF TEXAS AND ALSO
CONSENTED TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM VIOLATIONS OF TEXAS
SECURITIES ACT AND BOARD RULE SECTION 115.10.
ON APRIL 28, 2003, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS,
FINDINGS OR CONCLUSIONS OF VARIOUS FEDERAL AND STATE
REGULATORS AND SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATIONS, APPLICANT
CONSENTED TO A FINAL "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT". UNDER THE TERMS OF
THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT ENTERED INTO CONSENT
AGREEMENTS AND OTHER DEFINITIVE DOCUMENTS WITH THE SEC, THE
NYSE, THE NASD, AND VARIOUS STATE REGULATORS TO RESOLVE THEIR
INVESTIGATIONS OF APPLICANT RELATING TO THE ALLEGED CONFLICT
BETWEEN EQUITY RESEARCH AND INVESTMENT BANKING. APPLICANT
ALSO CONSENTED TO A VOLUNTARY INITIATIVE IMPOSING RESTRICTIONS
ON THE ALLOCATION OF SHARES IN INITIAL PUBLIC OFFERINGS TO
EXECUTIVES AND DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC COMPANIES.

PURSUANT TO THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT CONSENTED TO
THE ENTRY OF THE FINAL JUDGMENT. THE FINAL JUDGMENT: (1) IMPOSED
THE MONETARY SANCTIONS DESCRIBED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE; (2)
REQUIRED APPLICANT TO ADOPT VARIOUS ADDITIONAL POLICIES,
SYSTEMS, PROCEDURES AND OTHER SAFEGUARDS TO ENSURE
FURTHER THE INTEGRITY OF APPLICANT'S INVESTMENT RESEARCH; AND
(3) PERMANENTLY RESTRAINED AND ENJOINED APPLICANT FROM
VIOLATING NYSE 342, 401, 472, 476(A)(6) AND NASD RULES 2110, 2210 AND
3010 RELATING TO INVESTMENT RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. ANY MONETARY
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC
PENALTIES AND OTHER PAYMENTS REQUIRED BY SUCH ARRANGEMENTS

586

(3) PERMANENTLY RESTRAINED AND ENJOINED APPLICANT FROM
VIOLATING NYSE 342, 401, 472, 476(A)(6) AND NASD RULES 2110, 2210 AND
3010 RELATING TO INVESTMENT RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. ANY MONETARY

ARE EXPECTED TO BE INCLUDED WITHIN THE AGGREGATE AMOUNT
DISCUSSED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE.

Allegations:

THIS PROCEEDING AROSE OUT OF A JOINT INVESTIGATION BY THE
SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION ("SEC"), THE NEW YORK
STOCK EXCHANGE ("NYSE"), THE NASD REGULATION, INC. ("NASD") AND
VARIOUS STATE REGULATORY AGENCIES INTO ALLEGED CONFLICTS OF
INTEREST BETWEEN THE APPLICANT'S EQUITY RESEARCH DEPARTMENT
AND ITS INVESTMENT BANKING DEPARTMENT. THE ENSUING "GLOBAL"
SETTLEMENT INVOLVED THE APPLICANT AND NINE OTHER LARGE
SECURITIES FIRMS.

REGULATORS AND SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATIONS, APPLICANT

BETWEEN EQUITY RESEARCH AND INVESTMENT BANKING. APPLICANT
ALSO CONSENTED TO A VOLUNTARY INITIATIVE IMPOSING RESTRICTIONS
ON THE ALLOCATION OF SHARES IN INITIAL PUBLIC OFFERINGS TO
EXECUTIVES AND DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC COMPANIES.

A CENSURE, A TWENTY-FIVE THOUSAND DOLLAR ($25,000) FINE, AND
DISGORGEMENT IN THE AMOUNT OF ONE HUNDRED SIXTY FOUR
THOUSAND NINE HUNDRED TWELVE DOLLARS AND FIFTY CENTS
($164,912.50).

Regulator Statement

BEAR STEARNS & CO., INC., AN EXCHANGE MEMBER ORGANIZATION, WAS
CENSURED, FINED $25,000 AND ORDERED TO PAY A DISGORGEMENT IN
THE AMOUNT OF $164,912.50 FOR THE FOLLOWING CONDUCT. BEAR
STEARNS CREATED AN OFF BOARD TRANSACTION THROUGH AN OCC
ADJUSTMENT FOR THE PURPOSE OTHER THAN CORRECTING A BONA
FIDE ERROR. AS A RESULT, BEAR STEARNS IMPROPERLY EXERCISED 450
YAA JAN 60 CALL OPTION CONTRACTS FOR ITS FIRM ACCOUNT. (CBOE
RULES
4.1 - JUST
AND EQUITABLE
PRINCIPLES OF TRADE, 4.6 - FALSE

THE APPLICANT ALSO CONSENTED TO THE TERMS OF THE "GLOBAL
SETTLEMENT" ENTERED INTO BY MANY OF THE LEADING U.S. SECURITIES
FIRMS.

THIRD-PARTY

Firm Statement

THE "GLOBAL" SETTLEMENT INVOLVES PAYMENT BY APPLICANT OF A
TOTAL AMOUNT OF $80 MILLION: (1) $25 MILLION AS A PENALTY; (2) $25
MILLION AS DISGORGEMENT TO A DISTRIBUTION FUND FOR THE BENEFIT
OF CERTAIN CUSTOMERS; (3) $25 MILLION TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT
THIRD-PARTY RESEARCH OVER FIVE YEARS FOR CLIENTS; AND (4) $5
MILLION OVER FIVE YEARS FOR INVESTOR EDUCATION. THIS $80 MILLION
FIGURE IS AN AGGREGATE AMOUNT THAT ENCOMPASSES THE
SETTLEMENT WITH THE SEC, NYSE, NASD AND THE VARIOUS STATES.
THESE AMOUNTS WILL BE PAID AS PRESCRIBED IN SEC LITIGATION
RELEASE NO. 18438 AND IN THE FINAL JUDGMENT (THE "FINAL
JUDGMENT") ENTERED BY THE DISTRICT COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN
DISTRICT OF NEW YORK IN NO. 03 CIV. 2937 (WHP) ON OCTOBER 31, 2003.

User Guidance

UNDER THE TERMS OF A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED WITH THE STATE OF
NEW JERSEY ON APRIL 28, 2003, THE APPLICANT CONSENTED TO PAY A
MONETARY PENALTY OF $648,335 TO THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY AND
ALSO CONSENTED TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM VIOLATIONS OF N.J.S.A.
49:3-58(A)(2)(VII) & (XI).
ON APRIL 28, 2003, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS,
FINDINGS OR CONCLUSIONS OF VARIOUS FEDERAL AND STATE
REGULATORS AND SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATIONS, APPLICANT
CONSENTED TO A FINAL "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT". UNDER THE TERMS OF
THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT ENTERED INTO CONSENT
AGREEMENTS AND OTHER DEFINITIVE DOCUMENTS WITH THE SEC, THE
NYSE, THE NASD, AND VARIOUS STATE REGULATORS TO RESOLVE THEIR
INVESTIGATIONS OF APPLICANT RELATING TO THE ALLEGED CONFLICT
BETWEEN EQUITY RESEARCH AND INVESTMENT BANKING. APPLICANT
ALSO CONSENTED TO A VOLUNTARY INITIATIVE IMPOSING RESTRICTIONS
ON THE ALLOCATION OF SHARES IN INITIAL PUBLIC OFFERINGS TO
EXECUTIVES AND DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC COMPANIES.
PURSUANT TO THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT CONSENTED TO
THE ENTRY OF THE FINAL JUDGMENT. THE FINAL JUDGMENT: (1) IMPOSED
THE MONETARY SANCTIONS DESCRIBED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE; (2)
REQUIRED APPLICANT TO ADOPT VARIOUS ADDITIONAL POLICIES,
SYSTEMS, PROCEDURES AND OTHER SAFEGUARDS TO ENSURE
FURTHER THE INTEGRITY OF APPLICANT'S INVESTMENT RESEARCH; AND
(3) PERMANENTLY RESTRAINED AND ENJOINED APPLICANT FROM
VIOLATING NYSE 342, 401, 472, 476(A)(6) AND NASD RULES 2110, 2210 AND
3010 RELATING TO INVESTMENT RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. ANY MONETARY
PENALTIES AND OTHER PAYMENTS REQUIRED BY SUCH ARRANGEMENTS
ARE EXPECTED TO BE INCLUDED WITHIN THE AGGREGATE AMOUNT
DISCUSSED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE.

User Guidance

Allegations:

THIS PROCEEDING AROSE OUT OF A JOINT INVESTIGATION BY THE
SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION ("SEC"), THE NEW YORK
STOCK EXCHANGE ("NYSE"), THE NASD REGULATION, INC. ("NASD") AND
VARIOUS STATE REGULATORY AGENCIES INTO ALLEGED CONFLICTS OF
INTEREST BETWEEN THE APPLICANT'S EQUITY RESEARCH DEPARTMENT
AND ITS INVESTMENT BANKING DEPARTMENT. THE ENSUING "GLOBAL"
SETTLEMENT INVOLVED THE APPLICANT AND NINE OTHER LARGE
SECURITIES FIRMS.

Initiated By:

UNDER THE TERMS OF A CONSENT ORDER ENTERED WITH THE STATE OF
HAWAII ON MAY 21, 2003, THE APPLICANT CONSENTED TO PAY A
MONETARY PENALTY OF $250,000 TO THE STATE OF HAWAII AND ALSO
CONSENTED TO CEASE AND DESIST FROM FUTURE VIOLATIONS OF THE
UNIFORM SECURITIES ACT, H.R.S. CH. 485.
ON APRIL 28, 2003, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS,
FINDINGS OR CONCLUSIONS OF VARIOUS FEDERAL AND STATE
REGULATORS AND SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATIONS, APPLICANT
CONSENTED TO A FINAL "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT". UNDER THE TERMS OF
THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT ENTERED INTO CONSENT
AGREEMENTS AND OTHER DEFINITIVE DOCUMENTS WITH THE SEC, THE
NYSE, THE NASD, AND VARIOUS STATE REGULATORS TO RESOLVE THEIR
INVESTIGATIONS OF APPLICANT RELATING TO THE ALLEGED CONFLICT
BETWEEN EQUITY RESEARCH AND INVESTMENT BANKING. APPLICANT
ALSO CONSENTED TO A VOLUNTARY INITIATIVE IMPOSING RESTRICTIONS
ON THE ALLOCATION OF SHARES IN INITIAL PUBLIC OFFERINGS TO
EXECUTIVES AND DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC COMPANIES.
PURSUANT TO THE "GLOBAL SETTLEMENT", APPLICANT CONSENTED TO
THE ENTRY OF THE FINAL JUDGMENT. THE FINAL JUDGMENT: (1) IMPOSED
THE MONETARY SANCTIONS DESCRIBED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE; (2)
REQUIRED APPLICANT TO ADOPT VARIOUS ADDITIONAL POLICIES,
SYSTEMS, PROCEDURES AND OTHER SAFEGUARDS TO ENSURE
FURTHER THE INTEGRITY OF APPLICANT'S INVESTMENT RESEARCH; AND
(3) PERMANENTLY RESTRAINED AND ENJOINED APPLICANT FROM
VIOLATING NYSE 342, 401, 472, 476(A)(6) AND NASD RULES 2110, 2210 AND
3010 RELATING TO INVESTMENT RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. ANY MONETARY
PENALTIES AND OTHER PAYMENTS REQUIRED BY SUCH ARRANGEMENTS
ARE EXPECTED TO BE INCLUDED WITHIN THE AGGREGATE AMOUNT
DISCUSSED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE.

Allegations:

NASD CONDUCT RULE 2110, AND NASD MARKETPLACE RULES 6620(A) AND
6420(A) - RESPONDENT MEMBER ("FIRM") FAILED, WITHIN 90 SECONDS
AFTER EXECUTION, TO TRANSMIT THROUGH ACT LAST SALE REPORTS OF
TRANSACTIONS IN OTC EQUITY SECURITIES AND CONSOLIDATED
QUOTATION SERVICE ("CQS") SECURITIES. THE FIRM ALSO FAILED, WITHIN
90 SECONDS AFTER EXECUTION, TO TRANSMIT THROUGH ACT LAST SALE
REPORTS OF TRANSACTIONS IN OTC EQUITY SECURITIES AND CQS
SECURITIES AND FAILED TO DESIGNATE THROUGH ACT SUCH LAST SALE
REPORT AS LATE. IN ADDITION, THE FIRM INCORRECTLY DESIGNATED
AS .SLD THROUGH ACT LAST SALE REPORTS OF TRANSACTIONS IN OTC
EQUITY SECURITIES AND CQS SECURITIES REPORTED TO ACT WITHIN 90
SECONDS OF EXECUTION.

Allegations:

NASD MARKETPLACE RULE 4613(E) - RESPONDENT MEMBER, A MARKET
MAKER IN SECURITIES, WITHOUT MAKING REASONABLE EFFORTS TO

OCCUR IN EACH INSTANCE.

ENTRY OF FINDINGS; THEREFORE, THE FIRM IS CENSURED AND FINED
$7,500.

Allegations:

SEC RULE 11AC1-4 - THE RESPONDENT MEMBER FAILED TO DISPLAY
IMMEDIATELY THE CUSTOMER LIMIT ORDERS IN NASDAQ OR EXCHANGE
LISTED SECURITIES IN ITS PUBLIC QUOTATION, WHEN EACH SUCH ORDER
WAS AT A PRICE THAT WOULD HAVE IMPROVED THE FIRM'S BID OR OFFER
IN EACH SUCH SECURITY; OR WHEN THE ORDER WAS PRICED EQUAL TO
THE FIRM'S BID OR OFFER AND THE NATIONAL BEST BID OR OFFER IN
SUCH SECURITY, AND THE SIZE OF THE ORDER REPRESENTED MORE
THAN A DE MINIMIS CHANGE IN RELATION TO THE SIZE ASSOCIATED WITH
ITS BID OR OFFER IN EACH SUCH SECURITY.

Decision

Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC

www.finra.org/brokercheck

User Guidance

Resolution Date:

05/22/2003

Sanctions Ordered:

Censure
Monetary/Fine $80,000,000.00

Other Sanctions Ordered:
Sanction Details:

**04/22/2003** DECISION 03-63 ISSUED BY NYSE HEARING PANEL
DECISION: VIOLATED EXCHANGE RULES 476(A)(6) AND 401 BY ENGAGING
IN ACTS AND PRACTICES THAT CREATED OR MAINTAINED INAPPROPRIATE
INFLUENCE BY INVESTMENT BANKING OVER RESEARCH ANALYSTS,
THEREFORE IMPOSING CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ON ITS RESEARCH
ANALYSTS, BY FAILING TO MANAGE THESE CONFLICTS IN AN ADEQUATE
OR APPROPRIATE MANNER, BY ISSUING RESEARCH REPORTS THAT WERE
AFFECTED BY THE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST, AND BY FAILING TO
DISCLOSE IN OFFERING DOCUMENTS A PAYMENT FOR RESEARCH TO
ANOTHER BROKER-DEALER IN CONNECTION WITH AN UNDERWRITING
TRANSACTION; VIOLATED EXCHANGE RULE 472 BY ISSUING RESEARCH
REPORTS THAT CONTAINED RECOMMENDATIONS AND/OR RATINGS THAT
WERE EXAGGERATED OR UNWARRANTED AND/OR CONTAINED OPINIONS
FOR WHICH THERE WAS NO REASONABLE BASIS, AND BY FAILING TO
DISCLOSE OR CAUSE TO BE DISCLOSED IN OFFERING DOCUMENTS OR
ELSEWHERE A PAYMENT FOR RESEARCH TO ANOTHER BROKER-DEALER
IN CONNECTION WITH AN UNDERWRITING TRANSACTION; AND VIOLATED
EXCHANGE RULE 342 BY FAILING TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN ADEQUATE
POLICIES, SYSTEMS AND PROCEDURES FOR SUPERVISION AND CONTROL
OF ITS RESEARCH AND INVESTMENT BANKING DEPARTMENTS. CONSENT
TO A CENSURE, A TOTAL PAYMENT OF $80,000,000 AS SPECIFIED IN THE
FINAL JUDGMENT ORDERED IN A RELATED ACTION FILED BY THE
SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION, THE PAYMENT PROVISIONS
OF WHICH ARE INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE HEREIN. OF THIS
AMOUNT, $25,000,000 CONSTITUTES A PENALTY, $25,000,000 CONSTITUTES
DISGORGEMENT, $25,000,000, TO BE USED FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF
INDEPENDENT RESEARCH, AS DESCRIBED IN THE UNDERTAKINGS SET
FORTH IN ADDENDUM A: UNDERTAKING TO THE FINAL JUDGMENT
(ADDENDUM A), INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE HEREIN; AND $5,000,000,
TO BE USED FOR INVESTOR EDUCATION, AS DESCRIBED IN SECTION IX
OF THE FINAL JUDGMENT. IN ADDITION, THE FIRM SHALL COMPLETE AN
UNDERTAKING TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE TERMS PROVIDED IN
ADDENDUM A, **CONTINUED IN #13**

Regulator Statement

INCLUDING AN UNDERTAKING TO INFORM THE EXCHANGE IN WRITING
THAT IT HAS POLICIES, SYSTEMS, AND PROCEDURES REASONABLY
DESIGNED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF
ADDENDUM A. **05/22/2003** THE DECISION IS NOW FINAL AND IS
EFFECTIVE IMMEDIATELY. CONTACT: EVELYN PENA (212) 656-5211.

Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

THIS PROCEEDING AROSE OUT OF A JOINT INVESTIGATION BY THE
SECURITIES AND EXCHANGE COMMISSION ("SEC"), THE NEW YORK
STOCK EXCHANGE ("NYSE"), THE NASD REGULATION, INC. ("NASD") AND
VARIOUS STATE REGULATORY AGENCIES INTO ALLEGED CONFLICTS OF
INTEREST BETWEEN THE APPLICANT'S EQUITY RESEARCH DEPARTMENT
AND ITS INVESTMENT BANKING DEPARTMENT. THE ENSUING "GLOBAL"
SETTLEMENT INVOLVED THE APPLICANT AND NINE OTHER LARGE
SECURITIES FIRMS.

Initiated By:

NEW YORK STOCK EXCHANGE, INC. (AS PART OF A MULTI-REGULATOR
SETTLEMENT)

Date Initiated:

04/22/2003

Docket/Case Number:

HPD# 03-63

Principal Product Type:

Other

Other Product Type(s):

RESEARCH

Principal Sanction(s)/Relief
Sought:

Civil and Administrative Penalt(ies) /Fine(s)

Other Sanction(s)/Relief
Sought:

CENSURE; DISGORGEMENT; PAYMENT TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT
RESEARCH; PAYMENT FOR INVESTOR EDUCATION; UNDERTAKING TO
ADOPT ADDITIONAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO PROMOTE
INTEGRITY AND INDEPENDENCE OF RESEARCH.

Resolution:

Decision

Resolution Date:

05/22/2003

Sanctions Ordered:

Censure
Monetary/Fine $25,000,000.00
Disgorgement/Restitution

Other Sanctions Ordered:

PAYMENT TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT RESEARCH; PAYMENT FOR
INVESTOR EDUCATION; UNDERTAKING TO ADOPT POLICIES AND
PROCEDURES TO PROMOTE THE INTEGRITY AND INDEPENDENCE OF
RESEARCH.

Sanction Details:

THE "GLOBAL" SETTLEMENT INVOLVES PAYMENT BY APPLICANT OF A
TOTAL AMOUNT OF $80 MILLION: (1) $25 MILLION AS A PENALTY; (2) $25
MILLION AS DISGORGEMENT TO A DISTRIBUTION FUND FOR THE BENEFIT
OF CERTAIN CUSTOMERS; (3) $25 MILLION TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT
THIRD-PARTY RESEARCH OVER FIVE YEARS FOR CLIENTS; AND (4) $5
MILLION
OVER SECURITIES
FIVE YEARS
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about
J.P. MORGAN
LLCFOR INVESTOR EDUCATION. THIS $80 MILLION
FIGURE IS AN AGGREGATE AMOUNT THAT ENCOMPASSES THE

609

www.finra.org/brokercheck

Firm Statement

THE "GLOBAL" SETTLEMENT INVOLVES PAYMENT BY APPLICANT OF A
TOTAL AMOUNT OF $80 MILLION: (1) $25 MILLION AS A PENALTY; (2) $25
MILLION AS DISGORGEMENT TO A DISTRIBUTION FUND FOR THE BENEFIT
OF CERTAIN CUSTOMERS; (3) $25 MILLION TO PROCURE INDEPENDENT
THIRD-PARTY RESEARCH OVER FIVE YEARS FOR CLIENTS; AND (4) $5
MILLION OVER FIVE YEARS FOR INVESTOR EDUCATION. THIS $80 MILLION
FIGURE IS AN AGGREGATE AMOUNT THAT ENCOMPASSES THE
SETTLEMENT WITH THE SEC, NYSE, NASD AND THE VARIOUS STATES.
THESE AMOUNTS WILL BE PAID AS PRESCRIBED IN THE FINAL JUDGMENT
(THE "FINAL JUDGMENT") EXPECTED TO BE ENTERED BY THE DISTRICT
COURT FOR THE SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK IN NO. 03 CIV. 2937
(WHP).

User Guidance

ON APRIL 28, 2003, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS,
FINDINGS OR CONCLUSIONS OF VARIOUS FEDERAL AND STATE
REGULATORS AND SELF-REGULATORY ORGANIZATIONS, APPLICANT
CONSENTED TO A FINAL SETTLEMENT INVOLVING MANY OF THE LEADING
U.S. SECURITIES FIRMS. THE VARIOUS REGULATORY COMPLAINTS
ALLEGED CONFLICTS OF INTEREST RELATING TO THE ALLEGED
INVOLVEMENT OF RESEARCH ANALYSTS WITH INVESTMENT BANKING
ACTIVITIES. UNDER THE TERMS OF THE SETTLEMENT, APPLICANT
ENTERED INTO CONSENT AGREEMENTS AND OTHER DEFINITIVE
DOCUMENTS WITH THE SEC, THE NYSE, THE NASD, AND THE STATE OF
NEW JERSEY, BUREAU OF SECURITIES, TO RESOLVE THEIR
INVESTIGATIONS OF APPLICANT RELATING TO THOSE MATTERS.
PURSUANT TO THE SETTLEMENT, APPLICANT CONSENTED TO THE ENTRY
OF THE FINAL JUDGMENT. THE FINAL JUDGMENT IS EXPECTED TO: (1)
IMPOSE THE MONETARY SANCTIONS DESCRIBED IN QUESTION 12C.
ABOVE; (2) REQUIRE APPLICANT TO ADOPT VARIOUS ADDITIONAL
POLICIES, SYSTEMS, PROCEDURES AND OTHER SAFEGUARDS TO
ENSURE FURTHER THE INTEGRITY OF APPLICANT'S INVESTMENT
RESEARCH; AND (3) PERMANENTLY RESTRAIN AND ENJOIN APPLICANT
FROM VIOLATING CERTAIN RULES OF THE NYSE AND THE NASD RELATING
TO INVESTMENT RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. IN CONNECTION WITH THE
SETTLEMENT, APPLICANT ALSO HAS CONSENTED TO A VOLUNTARY
INITIATIVE IMPOSING RESTRICTIONS ON THE ALLOCATION OF SHARES IN
INITIAL PUBLIC OFFERINGS TO EXECUTIVES AND DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC
COMPANIES.
THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY, BUREAU OF SECURITIES ACTED AS
APPLICANT'S LEAD STATE REGULATOR IN CONNECTION WITH THE
SETTLEMENT. APPLICANT EXPECTS TO REACH SIMILAR ARRANGEMENTS
WITH MOST OR ALL OF THE REMAINING STATES, THE DISTRICT OF
COLUMBIA AND THE COMMONWEALTH OF PUERTO RICO. ANY MONETARY
PENALTIES AND OTHER PAYMENTS REQUIRED BY SUCH ARRANGEMENTS
ARE EXPECTED TO BE INCLUDED WITHIN THE AGGREGATE AMOUNT
DISCUSSED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE.

Disclosure 261 of 331

Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC

610

www.finra.org/brokercheck

User Guidance

Reporting Source:

Regulator

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

NASD CONDUCT RULES 2110, 2210(D)(1), 2210(D)(1)(A), 2210(D)(2), AND
3010(A) - RESPONDENT MEMBER ENGAGED IN ACTS AND PRACTICES THAT
CREATED AND/OR MAINTAINED INAPPROPRIATE INFLUENCE BY
INVESTMENT BANKING OVER RESEARCH ANALYSTS AND THEREFORE
IMPOSED CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ON ITS RESEARCH ANALYST; FAILED
TO MANAGE THESE CONFLICTS IN AN ADEQUATE OR APPROPRIATE
MANNER; ISSUED CERTAIN RESEARCH REPORTS FOR COMPANIES THAT
WERE NOT BASED ON PRINCIPLES OF FAIR DEALING AND GOOD FAITH
AND DID NOT PROVIDE A SOUND BASIS FOR EVALUATING FACTS,
CONTAINED EXAGGERATE OR UNWARRANTED CLAIMS ABOUT THESE
COMPANIES, AND/OR CONTAINED OPINION S FOR WHICH THERE WAS NO
REASONABLE BASIS; FAILED TO DISCLOSE OR CAUSE TO BE DISCLOSED
IN OFFERING DOCUMENTS OR ELSEWHERE A PAYMENT FOR RESEARCH
TO ANOTHER BROKER-DEALER IN CONNECTION WITH AN UNDERWRITING
TRANSACTION; FAILED O ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN ADEQUATE POLICIES,
SYSTEM, AND PROCEDURES FOR SUPERVISION AND CONTROL OF ITS
RESEARCH AND INVESTMENT BANKING DEPARTMENTS REASONABLY
DESIGNED TO DETECT AND PREVENT THE FOREGOING INVESTMENT
BANKING INFLUENCE AND MANAGE THE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST;
INCLUDING A SEPARATE SYSTEM OF FOLLOW-UP AND REVIEW TO ASSURE
COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE NASD RULES.

Initiated By:

NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF SECURITIES DEALERS, INC.

www.finra.org/brokercheck

User Guidance

Other Sanctions Ordered:

$25,000,000, TO BE USED FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF INDEPENDENT
RESEARCH UNDERTAKING TO THE FINAL JUDGMENT; AND $5,000,000, TO
BE USED FOR INVESTOR EDUCATION AS DESCRIBED IN THE FINAL
JUDGMENT.

Sanction Details:

WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS, RESPONDENT
MEMBER CONSENTED TO THE DESCRIBED SANCTIONS AND TO THE
ENTRY OF FINDINGS; THEREFORE, THE FIRM IS CENSURED AND
REQUIRED TO PAY $80,000,000, AS SPECIFIED IN THE FINAL JUDGMENT
ORDERED IN A RELATED ACTION FILED BY THE SEC AS FOLLOWS: (1)
$25,000,000, AS A FINE; (2) $25,000,000, AS DISGORGEMENT OF
COMMISSIONS, FEES AND OTHER MONIES; (3) $25,000,000, TO BE USED
FOR THE PROCUREMENT OF INDEPENDENT RESEARCH UNDERTAKING TO
THE FINAL JUDGMENT; AND (4)$5,000,000, TO BE USED FOR INVESTOR
EDUCATION AS DESCRIBED IN THE FINAL JUDGMENT. THE MONETARY
SANCTIONS IMPOSED SHALL BE REDUCED BY THE AMOUNTS PAID BY
RESPONDENT MEMBER PURSUANT TO THE FINAL JUDGMENT.

Regulator Statement

RESPONDENT MEMBER AGREES THAT IT SHALL NOT SEEK OR ACCEPT,
DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY, REIMBURSEMENT OR INDEMNIFICATION,
INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO PAYMENT MADE PURSUANT TO ANY
INSURANCE POLICY, WITH REGARD TO ANY FINE/PENALTY AMOUNTS THAT
RESPONDENT SHALL PAY PURSUANT TO SECTION II OF THE FINAL
JUDGMENT, REGARDLESS OF WHETHER SUCH FINE/PENALTY AMOUNTS
OR ANY PART THEREOF ARE ADDED TO THE DISTRIBUTION FUND
ACCOUNT OR OTHERWISE USED FOR THE BENEFIT OF INVESTORS.
RESPONDENT FURTHER AGREES THAT IT SHALL NOT CLAIM, ASSET, OR
APPLY FOR A TAX DEDUCTION OR TAX CREDIT WITH REGARD TO ANY
FEDERAL, STATE, OR LOCAL TAX FOR ANY FINE/PENALTY AMOUNTS THAT
RESPONDENT SHALL PAY PURSUANT TO SECTION II OF THE FINAL
JUDGMENT, REGARDLESS OF WHETHER SUCH FINE/PENALTY AMOUNTS
OR ANY PART THEREOF ARE ADDED TO THE DISTRIBUTION FUND
ACCOUNT OR OTHERWISE USED FOR THE BENEFIT OF INVESTORS.
RESPONDENT UNDERSTANDS AND ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THESE
PROVISIONS ARE NOT INTENDED TO IMPLY THAT NASD WOULD AGREE
THAT ANY OTHER AMOUNTS RESPONDENT SHALL PAY PURSUANT TO THE
FINAL JUDGMENT MAY BE REIMBURSED OR INDEMNIFIED (WHETHER
PURSUANT TO AN INSURANCE POLICY OR OTHERWISE) UNDER
APPLICABLE LAW OR MAY BE THE BASIS FOR ANY TAX DEDUCTION OR TAX
CREDIT WITH REGARD TO ANY FEDERAL, STATE, OR LOCAL TAX.

ON APRIL 28, 2003, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE ALLEGATIONS,

ALLEGED CONFLICTS OF INTEREST RELATING TO THE ALLEGED
INVOLVEMENT OF RESEARCH ANALYSTS WITH INVESTMENT BANKING
ACTIVITIES. UNDER THE TERMS OF THE SETTLEMENT, APPLICANT
ENTERED INTO CONSENT AGREEMENTS AND OTHER DEFINITIVE
DOCUMENTS WITH THE SEC, THE NYSE, THE NASD, AND THE STATE OF
NEW JERSEY, BUREAU OF SECURITIES, TO RESOLVE THEIR

OF THE FINAL JUDGMENT. THE FINAL JUDGMENT IS EXPECTED TO: (1)
IMPOSE THE MONETARY SANCTIONS DESCRIBED IN QUESTION 12C.
ABOVE; (2) REQUIRE APPLICANT TO ADOPT VARIOUS ADDITIONAL
POLICIES, SYSTEMS, PROCEDURES AND OTHER SAFEGUARDS TO
ENSURE FURTHER THE INTEGRITY OF APPLICANT'S INVESTMENT
RESEARCH; AND (3) PERMANENTLY RESTRAIN AND ENJOIN APPLICANT
FROM VIOLATING CERTAIN RULES OF THE NYSE AND THE NASD RELATING
TO INVESTMENT RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. IN CONNECTION WITH THE
SETTLEMENT, APPLICANT ALSO HAS CONSENTED TO A VOLUNTARY
INITIATIVE IMPOSING RESTRICTIONS ON THE ALLOCATION OF SHARES IN
INITIAL PUBLIC OFFERINGS TO EXECUTIVES AND DIRECTORS OF PUBLIC
COMPANIES.
THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY, BUREAU OF SECURITIES ACTED AS
APPLICANT'S LEAD STATE REGULATOR IN CONNECTION WITH THE
SETTLEMENT. APPLICANT EXPECTS TO REACH SIMILAR ARRANGEMENTS
WITH MOST OR ALL OF THE REMAINING STATES, THE DISTRICT OF
COLUMBIA AND THE COMMONWEALTH OF PUERTO RICO. ANY MONETARY
PENALTIES AND OTHER PAYMENTS REQUIRED BY SUCH ARRANGEMENTS
ARE EXPECTED TO BE INCLUDED WITHIN THE AGGREGATE AMOUNT
DISCUSSED IN QUESTION 12C. ABOVE.

i
Disclosure 262 of 331
Reporting Source:

Regulator

Current Status:

Final

Other Sanctions Ordered:

THE SANCTION TO BE IMPOSED SHALL CONSIST OF A $7,500 FINE AND AN
UNDERTAKING TO ENSURE THAT BEAR STEARNS ENFORCE ITS
PROCEDURES TO MONITOR POSITION LIMITS ON BEHALF OF BEAR
STEARNS ACCOUNTS.

Sanction Details:

THE SANCTION TO BE IMPOSED SHALL CONSIST OF A $7,500 FINE AND AN
UNDERTAKING TO ENSURE THAT BEAR STEARNS ENFORCE ITS
PROCEDURES TO MONITOR POSITION LIMITS ON BEHALF OF BEAR
STEARNS ACCOUNTS.

Regulator Statement

BEAR STEARNS & CO., INC. AN EXCHANGE MEMBER ORGANIZATION, WAS
FINED $7,500 AND ORDERED TO ENSURE THAT BEAR STEARNS ENFORCE
ITS PROCEDURES TO MONITOR POSITION LIMITS ON BEHALF OF BEAR
STEARNS ACCOUNTS. THE APPLICABLE POSITION LIMIT IN THE
DEUTSCHE TELEKOM AG ADS (DT) WAS CLASS OF OPTION CONTRACTS
WAS 75,000 CONTRACTS ON THE SAME SIDE OF THE MARKET. FROM
APRIL 25, 2001 THROUGH APRIL 26, 2001, A CUSTOMER ACCOUNT
MAINTAINED AT BEAR STEARNS, CONTROLLED AN AGGREGATE SHORT
CALL, LONG PUT POSITION OF 90,764 OPTION CONTRACTS IN THE DT
OPTION CLASS. BEAR STEARNS, FAILED TO REPORT TO THE EXCHANGE
THAT THE CUSTOMER DESCRIBED ABOVE, MAINTAINED AN OPTIONS
POSITION IN VIOLATION OF THE ESTABLISHED POSITION LIMITS. (CBOE
RULES 4.11 - POSITION LIMITS AND 4.13(C) &#8211; REPORTS RELATED TO
POSITION LIMITS.)

i

Current Status:

REGARDING POSITION LIMITS.

Allegations:

11-02-00, SECTIONS 17(A)(2), 17(A)(3) OF THE SECURITIES ACT, NASD RULE
2110 - RESPONDENT MEMBER SOLD A PORTFOLIO OF U.S. TREASURY
SECURITIES FOR DEFEASANCE ESCROW AT EXCESSIVE, UNDISCLOSED
MARKUPS TO A MUNICIPALITY IN CONNECTION WITH AN ADVANCE
REFUNDING. THE FIRM EFFECTED DEFEASANCE ESCROW TRANSACTIONS
WITH THE MUNICIPALITY AT PRICES NOT REASONABLY RELATED TO THE
CURRENT WHOLESALE MARKET PRICES FOR THE SECURITIES UNDER
THE PARTICULAR FACTS AND CIRCUMSTANCES INCLUDING THE
PERTINENT TAX EGULATIONS;THE FIRM KNEW OR SHOULD HAVE KNOWN
THAT THE PRICES IT CHARGED WERE NOT REASONABLY RELATED TO THE
PREVAILING WHOLESALE MARKET PRICES OF THE SECURITIES. THE
EXCESSIVE MARKUPS JEOPARDIZED THE TAX-EXEMPT STATUS OF THE
MUNICIPALITY'S REFUNDING BONDS AND DIVERTED MONEY FROM THE
U.S. TREASURY TO THE FIRM WHEN THE TRANSACTION WAS IN POSITIVE
ARBITRAGE.

©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved.

Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC

624

www.finra.org/brokercheck

BEAR, STEARNS AGREES TO PARTICIPATE IN AN EDUCATIONAL
UNDERTAKING PURSUANT TO WHICH TRADERS IN ITS EXCHANGE TRADED
DERIVATIVES GROUP WILL ATTEND AN EDUCATIONAL SESSION
CONDUCTED BY THE EXCHANGE CONCERNING THE PROVISIONS OF
EXCHANGE RULE 6.9 - SOLICITATION.

Sanction Details:

A FIFTEEN THOUSAND DOLLAR ($15,000) JOINT AND SEVERAL
FINE AND A CENSURE OF EACH RESPONDENT. IN ADDITION, BEAR,
STEARNS AGREES TO PARTICIPATE IN AN
EDUCATIONAL UNDERTAKING PURSUANT TO WHICH TRADERS IN ITS
EXCHANGE TRADED DERIVATIVES GROUP WILL ATTEND AN EDUCATIONAL
SESSION CONDUCTED BY THE EXCHANGE CONCERNING THE
PROVISIONS OF EXCHANGE
RULE 6.9 - SOLICITATION.

Regulator Statement

BEAR, STEARNS & CO., INC., AN EXCHANGE MEMBER ORGANIZATION, AND
CHRISTOPHER MCGUIGAN, AS ASSOCIATED PERSON OF BEAR, STEARNS
AND ITS HEAD EQUITY OPTIONS TRADER, WERE EACH CENSURED AND
JOINTLY AND SEVERALLY FINED $15,000 FOR THE FOLLOWING
CONDUCT.ON FEBRUARY 3, 1999, AT APPROXIMATELY 1:48 P.M.(CT),
MCGUIGAN, ON BEHALF OF BEAR, STEARNS, RECEIVED A CUSTOMER
ORDER TO SELL 250 METRIS COMPANIES (MTRS/TWQ) FEB PUT OPTION
CONTRACTS ("ORIGINAL ORDER"). ON FEBRUARY 3, 1999, AT
APPROXIMATELY 1:50 P.M. (CT) AND 1:51 P.M. (CT) MCGUIGAN, ON BEHALF
OF BEAR, STEARNS, ENTERED ORDERS TO PURCHASE 5,000 SHARES AND
3,000 SHARES OF MTRS COMMON STOCK RESPECTIVELY, TO HEDGE
BEAR, STEARNS' ANTICIPATED FACILITATION OF A PORTION OF THE
ORIGINAL ORDER PRIOR TO DISCLOSING THE ORIGINAL ORDER TO THE
METRIS TRADING CROWD. ON FEBRUARY 3, 1999, AT APPROXIMATELY
1:52 P.M. (CST), MCGUIGAN ENTERED THE ORIGINAL ORDER ON THE
EXCHANGE FOR EXECUTION THROUGH ITS FLOOR BROKER AGENT ON
THE EXCHANGE TRADING FLOOR. AS A RESULT OF BEAR, STEARNS
ENTERED THE SUBJECT MTRS STOCK ORDER PRIOR TO DISCLOSING THE
TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE ORIGINAL ORDER TO THE MTRS
TRADING CROWD AS REQUIRED BY EXCHANGE RULE 6.9(E). (EXCHANGE
RULE 4.1.)

User Guidance

i

Regulator Statement

BEAR STEARNS & CO., INC. WAS FINED $10,000 FOR THE FOLLOWING
CONDUCT. DURING ALL RELEVANT PERIODS HEREIN, THE APPLICABLE
POSITION LIMIT IN THE BOSTON CHICKEN, INC. (BQN) CLASS OF OPTION
CONTRACTS WAS 25,000 CONTRACTS ON THE SAME SIDE OF THE
MARKET. DURING THE PERIOD FROM SEPTEMBER 2, 1998 THROUGH
SEPTEMBER 8, 1998, BEAR STEARNS WAS GRANTED A POSITION LIMIT
EXEMPTION PURSUANT TO EXCHANGE RULE 4.11 TO 52,024 SHORT CALL,
LONG PUT OPTION CONTRACTS IN THE BQN CLASS OF OPTION
CONTACTS. ON SEPTEMBER 9, 1998, BEAR STEARNS WAS GRANTED A
POSITION LIMIT EXEMPTION PURSUANT TO EXCHANGE RULE 4.11 TO
54,449 SHORT CALL, LONG PUT OPTION CONTRACTS IN THE BQN CLASS
OF OPTION CONTACTS. SUBSEQUENTLY, ON SEPTEMBER 10, 1998, BEAR
STEARNS REQUESTED A POSITION LIMIT EXEMPTION UP TO 60,149 BQN
OPTION CONTRACTS. ON AUGUST 24, 1998, BEAR STEARNS CONTROLLED
AN AGGREGATE SHORT CALL, LONG PUT POSITION OF 29,055 BQN OPTION
CONTRACTS IN ITS PROPRIETARY ACCOUNT. ON OR ABOUT SEPTEMBER
4, 1998, BEAR STEARNS CONTROLLED AN AGGREGATE SHORT CALL,
LONG PUT POSITION OF 53,894 BQN OPTION CONTRACTS IN ITS
PROPRIETARY ACCOUNT. ON SEPTEMBER 8, 1998 THROUGH SEPTEMBER
18, 1998, BEAR STEARNS CONTROLLED AN AGGREGATE SHORT CALL,
LONG PUT POSITION OF 56,319 BQN OPTION CONTRACTS IN ITS
PROPRIETARY ACCOUNT. BEAR STEARNS HAD REQUESTED AND
BELIEVED IT WAS GRANTED AN EXEMPTION UP TO 60,149 BQN OPTION
CONTRACTS ON SEPTEMBER 10, 1998. IN ACCEPTING THE OFFER, THE
COMMITTEE CONSIDERED THAT IN EACH CASE BEAR STEARNS SOUGHT
AND OBTAINED AN EXEMPTION TO INCREASE THE POSITION LIMITS.
HOWEVER, SUCH EXEMPTIONS TECHNICALLY SHOULD HAVE BEEN
OBTAINED PRIOR TO PLACING THE THREE TRADES DISCUSSED ABOVE.

i
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

ALLEGED TECHNICAL VIOLATIONS OF CBOE POSITION LIMITS.

Allegations:

**03/06/2000** STIPULATION AND CONSENT TO PENALTY FILED BY NYSE
DIVISION OF ENFORCEMENT AND PENDING CONSENTED TO FINDINGS:
WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING GUILT, BEAR STEARNS CONSENTS TO:
A.
A FINDING BY THE HEARING PANEL THAT IT:
1. VIOLATED EXCHANGE RULE 342(A) AND (B) IN THAT IT FAILED TO
REASONABLY DISCHARGE ITS DUTIES AND OBLIGATIONS IN CONNECTION
WITH SUPERVISION AND CONTROL OF AND PROVIDING SEPARATE
SYSTEMS OF FOLLOW-UP AND REVIEW, WITH RESPECT TO CERTAIN OF
ITS BUSINESS ACTIVITIES BY: A. FAILING TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN
APPROPRIATE PROCEDURES AND SYSTEMS NECESSARY TO ADEQUATELY
SUPERVISE ITS MARGIN DEPARTMENT;
B. FAILING TO HAVE REASONABLE SYSTEMS CONTROLLING THE
ASSIGNMENT OF ACCOUNT CODES AND NUMERICAL DESIGNATIONS;
C. FAILING TO ENSURE THAT APPROPRIATE DOCUMENTATION WAS
COMPLETED BEFORE ENTERING AND CLEARING TRADES EXECUTED
AWAY FROM THE FIRM; D. ENTERING ?AS OF? OR LATE TRADES IN
CERTAIN CUSTOMER ACCOUNTS WITHOUT SUPERVISORY
AUTHORIZATION OR SUFFICIENT EXPLANATION AND DOCUMENTATION; E.
FAILING TO REVIEW AND DOCUMENT REVIEW OF
CORRESPONDENCE OF CERTAIN REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVES; F.
FAILING TO ENSURE THAT REQUIRED ORDER ENTRY DATA IS CAPTURED
ON CERTAIN ORDER TICKETS IN ORDER TO PROVIDE FOR MEANINGFUL
REVIEW OF CUSTOMER TRANSACTIONS; AND G. FAILING TO ENSURE THAT
RESTRICTED SECURITIES PURCHASES PURSUANT TO REGULATION 144A
WERE PURCHASED ONLY BY QUALIFIED INSTITUTIONAL BUYERS.

Sanction Details:

**05/18/2000** HEARING PANEL DECISION 00-78 VIOLATED RULE 342(A) AND
(B) BY FAILING TO REASONABLY DISCHARGE ITS DUTIES AND
OBLIGATIONS IN CONNECTION WITH SUPERVISION AND CONTROL AND
PROVIDING SEPARATE SYSTEMS OF FOLLOW-UP AND REVIEW; VIOLATED
RULE 405(1) AND (2) BY FAILING TO USE DUE DILIGENCE TO LEARN THE
ESSENTIAL FACTS RELATIVE TO EVERY CUSTOMER; VIOLATED RULE
431(F)(7) BY PERMITTING CUSTOMERS TO DEFER DEPOSITS AND RULE
431(F)(8) BY FAILING TO OBTAIN FUNDS NECESSARY TO MEET MARGIN
REQUIREMENTS IN A DAY TRADING ACCOUNT; VIOLATED RULE 410 BY
FAILING TO PRESERVE A RECORD OF EVERY ORDER SUBMITTED TO THE
FLOOR; AND VIOLATED RULE 440 AND SEC REGS. 17A-3 AND 17A-4 BY
FAILING TO MAKE AND PRESERVE ACCURATE BOOKS AND RECORDS CONSENT TO CENSURE, $400,000 FINE AND AN UNDERTAKING.

Regulator Statement

**06/23/2000** THE DECISION IS NOW FINAL. THE BAR OR SUSPENSION
IMPOSED IS EFFECTIVE IMMEDIATELY. CONTACT: PEGGY GERMINO (212)
656-8450.

UNDERTAKING PURSUANT TO WHICH IT WILL RETAIN AN OUTSIDE

RESPECT TO CERTAIN OF THE FIRM'S SUPERVISORY AND COMPLIANCE

Sanction Details:

ON MAY 18, 2000, A HEARING PANEL OF THE NEW YORK STOCK EXCHANGE
("NYSE") APPROVED A STIPULATION OF FACTS AND CONSENT TO PENALTY
(THE "AGREEMENT") BETWEEN THE NYSE AND BEAR, STEARNS & CO. INC.
PURSUANT TO THIS AGREEMENT, AND WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING
ANY WRONGDOING, BEAR STEARNS CONSENTED TO A CENSURE AND A
$400,000 FINE WITH RESPECT TO ALLEGATIONS THAT BEAR STEARNS
VIOLATED NYSE RULES 342(A) AND (B), 405(1) AND (2), 431(F)(7) AND (8),
410, 440 AND SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT RULES 17A-3 AND 17A-4, IN
CONNECTION WITH CERTAIN BUSINESS ACTIVITIES AND CERTAIN
TRADING ACTIVITY IN THE ACCOUNTS OF CERTAIN BEAR STEARNS'
CUSTOMERS. BEAR STEARNS ALSO AGREED TO AN UNDERTAKING
PURSUANT TO WHICH IT WILL RETAIN AN OUTSIDE CONSULTANT TO
CONDUCT A REVIEW AND PREPARE A REPORT WITH RESPECT TO CERTAIN
OF THE FIRM'S SUPERVISORY AND COMPLIANCE PROCEDURES.

Sanction Details:

THE MARKET SURVEILLANCE DEPARTMENT OF THE NEW YORK STOCK
EXCHANGE FINED BEAR, STEARNS & CO. INC. $1,000 FOR RECORD
RETENTION VIOLATIONS IN CONNECTION WITH TRANSACTIONS
EXECUTED BY THE FIRM THROUGH OTHER NYSE MEMBERS.

Firm Statement

THE TRADER DID NOT RETAIN ORDER TICKETS FOR THESE
TRANSACTIONS SINCE THE TRADER BELIEVED THAT BEAR, STEARNS &
CO. INC. WAS ACTING AS A CUSTOMER WITH RESPECT TO SUCH
TRANSACTIONS. THE NYSE TOOK THE POSITION THAT BEAR, STEARNS &
CO. INC. NEVERTHELESS SHOULD HAVE RETAINED COPIES OF ORDER
TICKETS.

i

Sanction Details:

THE ENFORCEMENT DIVISION OF THE AMERICAN STOCK EXCHANGE
ACCEPTED BEAR, STEARNS & CO. INC.'S (BEAR STEARNS) OFFER OF
SETTLEMENT WHEREBY BEAR STEARNS CONSENTED TO A $10,000 FINE.
IT WAS BEAR STEARNS' POSITION THAT THERE WAS NO SHOWING OF
WRONGDOING ON ITS PART AND THAT NO MEMBER OF THE PUBLIC
SUFFERED A LOSS IN THIS INCIDENT. BEAR STEARNS AGREED TO THE
FINE BECAUSE IT ACKNOWLEDGED ITS FAILURE TO IMPOSE A 90-DAY
FREEZE ON THIS ACCOUNT.

Other Sanctions Ordered:

MONETARY FINE OF $85,000 AND $30,000

Sanction Details:

IN CONNECTION WITH ITS LATE DELIVERY ON 561 CONTRACTS OF 8-1/8%
T-NOTES DUE FEBRUARY 15, 1988, BEAR, STEARNS & CO. INC. WAS FINED
$85,000 BY THE CLEARING CORPORATION OF THE CBOT AND $30,000 BY
THE BUSINESS CONDUCT COMMITTEE OF THE CBOT ON NOVEMBER 16,
1988. BEAR STEARNS ENTERED INTO A SETTLEMENT WITH THE BUSINESS
CONDUCT COMMITTEE WITHOUT ADMITTING TO THE ALLEGED VIOLATION.
BEAR STEARNS WAS LATE IN ITS DELIVERY BY APPROXIMATELY TWO
MINUTES BECAUSE OF A SCARCITY OF THE BONDS.

i
Disclosure 282 of 331

Other Sanctions Ordered:
Sanction Details:

WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING LIABILITY, THE PARTNERSHIP SETTLED
A CHARGE BY THE CHICAGO MERCANTILE EXCHANGE THAT IT FAILED TO
AGGREGATE THE POSITIONS OF TWO UNRELATED COMMODITY
CUSTOMERS WHO THE STAFF OF THE CME HAD REASON TO BELIEVE MAY
HAVE BEEN ACTING IN CONCERT. AS PART OF ITS SETTLEMENT WITH
THE CME, THE PARTNERSHIP AGREED TO PAY A FINE OF $5,000 AND
SENSITIZE ITS PERSONNEL TO THE AGGREGATION ISSUE TO ENSURE
THAT PROPER PROCEDURES WOULD BE FOLLOWED IN THE FUTURE,
PARTICULARLY WITH RESPECT TO THOSE CUSTOMERS THAT MAY BE
DEEMED TO HAVE BEEN ACTING IN CONCERT.

Firm Statement

CORRECTIVE ACTIONS - (NASD RULES 2110 AND IM 3110(f)(4) RESPONDENT MEMBER WAS NAMED AS A RESPONDENT IN CERTAIN
ARBITRATION PROCEEDINGS FILED WITH THE NASD BY VARIOUS PUBLIC
CUSTOMERS WHO INCLUDED DEMANDS FOR PUNITIVE DAMAGES AND/OR
ATTORNEYS' FEES IN THE PROCEEDINGS. EACH OF THOSE CUSTOMERS

PROCEEDING BY VIRTUE OF THE GOVERNING LAW CLAUSE IN THE
CUSTOMER AGREEMENT AND THAT NEW YORK LAW PRECLUDED AN
AWARD OF
PUNITIVE DAMAGES OR ATTORNEYS' FEES).

Allegations:

RESPONDENTS HAD ENGAGED PRIMARILY IN ONE OR MORE OF THE
FOLLOWING TYPES OF VIOLATIONS ARISING FROM MARKET MAKING
ACTIVITIES IN THE NASDAQ STOCK MARKET: THE COORDINATION OF
QUOTATIONS AND TRANSACTIONS BY TRADERS MAKING MARKETS IN
NASDAQ STOCKS IN VIOLATION OF ANTIFRAUD AND FICTITIOUS
QUOTATION RULES, THE INTENTIONAL DELAY OF TRADE REPORTS,
OTHER MANIPULATIVE ACTIVITY, FAILURE TO HONOR QUOTED PRICES,
FAILURE TO PROVIDE CUSTOMER ORDERS WITH BEST EXECUTION,
TRADING AS PRINCIPAL WITH ADVISORY CLIENTS OR DISCRETIONARY
CUSTOMERS,FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THE BOOKS AND RECORDS
REQUIREMENTS, AND FAILURE TO SUPERVISE.

User Guidance

[TOP] 2/11/99 SEC NEWS DIGEST, ISSUE NO. 99-6, THE SEC TODAY
ANNOUNCED THE INSTITUTION OF ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEEDINGS
AGAINST 28 NASDAQ MARKET MAKING FIRMS PURSUANT TO SECTIONS
15(B) AND 21C OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF 1934 AND, AS TO
ONE FIRM, PURSUANT TO SECTION 203(K) OF THE INVESTMENT ADVISERS
ACT OF 1940. SIMULTANEOUSLY WITH THE FILING OF THE ACTION, ALL OF
THE RESPONDENTS CONSENTED, WITHOUT ADMITTING OR DENYING THE
SEC'S FINDINGS, TO THE ENTRY OF ORDERS WHICH IMPOSE $26,302,500
IN CIVIL MONETARY PENALTIES, $791,525 DISGORGEMENT OF WRONGFUL
GAINS, SUSPENSIONS OR BARS, CEASE AND DESIST ORDERS AND OTHER
SANCTIONS. THE PROPOSED SANCTIONS TO WHICH THE FIRMS HAVE
CONSENTED INCLUDE CIVIL MONETARY PENALTIES, DISGORGEMENT OF
WRONGFUL GAINS, WHERE APPLICABLE, CEASE AND DESIST ORDERS,
AND IN THE CASE OF 22 OF THE BROKER-DEALERS, A REVIEW OF THEIR
POLICIES AND PROCEDURES RELATING TO THE AREAS OF THEIR
VIOLATIONS BY AN INDEPENDENT CONSULTANT TO BE APPOINTED BY THE
SEC. (RELS. 34-40900 THROUGH 34-40930, INCLUSIVE; IA-1781; FILE NO. 39803); (PRESS REL. 99-2)
*** 2/11/99CW SEC ADMINISTRATIVE PROCEEDING FILE NO. 3-9803
PURSUANT TO THE ORDER MAKING FINDINGS AND IMPOSING SANCTIONS:
BEAR STEARNS & CO., INC. SHALL CEASE AND DESIST FROM COMMITTING
OR CAUSING ANY FUTURE VIOLATION OF SECTIONS 15(C)(1) AND (2) OF
THE EXCHANGE ACT, AND RULES 15C1-2 AND 15C2-7 ("THE FRAUDULENT
COORDINATION OF QUOTE MOVEMENTS") THEREUNDER; SHALL WITHIN
10 BUSINESS DAYS OF THE ENTRY OF THIS ORDER, PAY A CIVIL PENALTY
IN THE AMOUNT OF $225,000; SHALL WITHIN 90 DAYS OF THE DATE OF THE
ENTRY OF THIS ORDER PROVIDE TO THE INDEPENDANT CONSULTANT
APPOINTED BY THE SEC IN CONNECTION WITH THESE PROCEEDINGS A
DESCRIPTION OF ITS POLICIES, PROCEDURES AND PRACTICES RELATING
TO PREVENTION OR DETECTION OF THE TYPES OF IMPROPER CONDUCT
INVOLVING BEAR STEARNS & CO., INC. DESCRIBED IN SECTION II OF THIS
ORDER.

Regulator Statement

[TOP]LETTER OF ACCEPTANCE, WAIVER AND CONSENT CMS980063 AWC.
ON 7/20/98, BEAR STEARNS & CO., INC.(BSC) WAS NOTIFIED THAT THE
(AWC)IT SUBMITTED ACCEPTED BY NASDR AND THE NATIONAL
ADJUDICATORY COUNCIL. IT ALLEGES BSC FAILED TO EXECUTE 20
SELECTNET ORDERS AT PUBLISHED BID OR OFFER EQUAL TO OR LESS
THAN ITS PUBLISHED QUOTE SIZE AND, FAILED TO HONOR ITS QUOTE.
CONSTITUTING VIOLATIONS OF SEC RULE 11AC1-1NASD CONDUCT RULE
(C RULE) 3320 AND NASD MARKETPLACE RULE (M RULE) 4613(B); BSC
FAILED TO DESIGNATE AS LATE 33 TRANSACTIONS IN NASDAQ
SECURITIES CONSTITUTING VIOLATIONS OF NASD RULE 4632(A) AND
NASD C RULE 2110.BSC FAILED TO REPORT CONTRA SIDE EXECUTING
BROKER IN 67 TRANSACTIONS IN ELIGIBLE SECURITIES CONSTITUTING
VIOLATIONS OF NASD M RULE 6130(D).BSC FAILED TO EXECUTE 6
CUSTOMER LIMIT ORDERS AFTER EXECUTING TRANSACTIONS FOR ITS
OWN MARKET-MAKING ACCOUNT AT PRICES EQUAL TO OR BETTER THAN
CUSTOMER LIMIT ORDER CONSTITUTING VIOLATIONS OF NASD C RULE
2110 AND IM-2110-2.
FROM 11/19/95 TO 3/ 14/97, BSC FAILED TO FILE REPORTS WITH NASDR
WITH RESPECT TO 7 BSC PROPRIETARY ACCOUNTS WHICH HAD
ESTABLISHED AN AGGREGATE POSITION OF 200 OR MORE OPTIONS
CONTRACTS OF THE PUT CLASS AND CALL CLASS ON THE SAME SIDE
OF THE MARKET COVERING THE SAME OR INDEX, CONSTITUTING
VIOLATIONS OF NASD C RULES 2110 AND 2860(B)(5). BSC FAILED TO
ESTABLISH, MAINTAIN AND ENFORCE WRITTEN SUPERVISORY
PROCEDURES DESIGNED TO ACHIEVE COMPLIANCE WITH SECURITIES
LAWS AND REGULATIONS REGARDING TRADE REPORTING, BSC
EXECUTION LIMIT ORDER PROTECTION INTERPRETATION, FIRM QUOTE
OBLIGATIONS AND REPORTING OF OPTIONS POSITIONS TO NASD. BSC
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES LLC
WAS CENSURED AND FINED $33,500. ALSO BSC SHALL PROVIDE

660

ESTABLISH, MAINTAIN AND ENFORCE WRITTEN SUPERVISORY

LAWS AND REGULATIONS REGARDING TRADE REPORTING, BSC
EXECUTION LIMIT ORDER PROTECTION INTERPRETATION, FIRM QUOTE

LETTER OF ACCEPTANCE, WAIVER AND CONSENT NO. CMS960020 AWC.
ON JULY 15, 1996, BEAR, STEARNS & CO., INC. (BEST) WAS NOTIFIED
THAT THE LETTER OF ACCEPTANCE, WAIVER AND CONSENT (AWC) IT
SUBMITTED WAS ACCEPTED BY THE MARKET SURVEILLANCE AND THE
NATIONAL BUSINESS CONDUCT COMMITTEES. UNDER THE AWC, BEST IS
ALLEGED TO HAVE VIOLATED SEC RULE 10b-6A IN THAT: (a) ON TWO
OCCASIONS, BEST PURCHASED SHARES WHICH WERE ABOVE THE
HIGHEST
INDEPENDENT MARKET MAKERS' BIDS; (b) ON ONE OCCASION, BEST
ENTERED A BID WHICH WAS HIGHER THAN THE HIGHEST INDEPENDENT
BID; (c) ON TWO OCCASIONS, BEST EXCEEDED ITS 30% ADTV LIMIT AND
DID NOT REMOVE ITS QUOTES IN A TIMELY FASHION.
BEST IS HEREBY FINED $1,000. THE AWC BECAME FINAL ON JULY
15, 1996.

Sanction Details:

fined $6,970.00

Regulator Statement

Bear Stearns : 1) on July 14, 1994 exercised 224
OEX Jul 410 call option contracts on behalf of its customer
account without submitting an advice to the Exchange indicating
the intent to exercise the option contracts; and 2) on
September 15, 1994 exercised 150 OEX Sep 435 call option
contracts and 20 OEX Sep 440 call option contracts respectively
on behalf of its customer account without submitting an advice
to the Exchange indicating the intent to exercise the option
contracts. With respect to File No. 96-0001, on December 13,
1994, Bear Stearns exercised 200 OEX Dec 440 put option
contracts on behalf of its customer account without submitting
an advice to the Exchange indicating the intent to exercise the
option contracts.

i
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

DISCIPLINARY ACTION AGAINST BEAR, STEARNS & CO. INC. ("BEAR
STEARNS") ALLEGING THAT BEAR STEARNS VIOLATED EXCHANGE RULE
11.1 BY FAILING TO SUBMIT OPTION EXERCISE ADVICE NOTICES TO THE
EXCHANGE IN A TIMELY MANNER.

677

www.finra.org/brokercheck

Sanctions Ordered:

User Guidance

Censure
Monetary/Fine $25,000.00

Other Sanctions Ordered:
Sanction Details:

BSC IS CENSURED AND FINED $25,000

Regulator Statement

MARKET SURVEILLANCE COMMITTEE COMPLAINT #MS-719 FILED 5/12/88
BY MSC NAMING AS RESPONDENT BEAR, STERNS & CO., INC.(BSC) 6
CAUSES OF COMPLAINT ALLEGE VIOLATIONS OF ARTICLE III, SECTION 1
OF NASD'S RULES OF FAIR PRACTICE AND SCHEDULE D OF NASD'S BYLAWS FOR FAILING TO REPORT OR INCORRECTLY REPORTING
NUMEROUS TRANSACTIONS IN NASDAQ/NMS SECURITIES 8/29/85,TO
1/21/88. CAUSES I THRU 5 ALLEGE TRADE REPORTING VIOLATIONS BY 5
DEPARTMENTS OF BSC,VIA ITS TRADERS. CAUSE 6, ALLEGES BSC, FAILED
TO REPORT TRANSACTIONS WITHIN 90 SECONDS AFTER EXECUTION, AND
FAILED TO IDENTIFY AGGREGATE TRANSACTION REPORTS REGARDING
TRANSACTIONS IN NASDAQ/NMS SECURITIES. CAUSE 7 ALLEGES
VIOLATIONS OF ARTICLE III, SECTION 1 OF THE ASSOCIATION'S RULES OF
FAIR PRACTICE AND SCHEDULE C OF THE ASSOCIATION'S BY-LAWS. THAT
FROM AT LEAST 8/29/85 TO NOW, BSC FAILED TO HAVE PERSONS,
QUALIFIED AND REGISTERED AS GENERAL SECURITIES PRINCIPALS.
CAUSE 8 ALLEGES VIOLATIONS OF ARTICLE III, ? 1 AND 27 OF THE NASD'S
RFP; THAT BSC FAILED TO ESTABLISH, MAINTAIN AND ENFORCE WRITTEN
SUPERVISORY PROCEDURES. BSC SETTLEMENT OFFER ON 8/9/88 WAS
ACCEPTED BY MSC ON 8/22/88 AND BY NASD ON 10/14/88. NASD IMPOSED
SANCTIONS: A) BSC IS CENSURED AND FINED $25,000; B) BSC WILL
UNDERTAKE TO ADOPT, IMPLEMENT AND ENFORCE WRITTEN
PROCEDURES C) BSC UNDERTAKES TO AUTOMATE ITS NASDAQ/NMS
TRADE REPORTING SYSTEM AND TO COORDINATE THE EFFORTS TO
SATISFY REPORTING REQUIREMENTS AND WILL THEN FILE QUARTERLY
PROGRESS REPORT REPPORTS. THE 1ST REPPORT TO BE FILED WITHIN
5 DAYS FOLLOWING 11/15/88; AND D) BSC UNDERSTAKES TO ADOPT,
IMPLEMENT AND ENFORCE WRITTEN PROCEDURES TO INSURE THE FULL
AND COMPLETE REGISTRATION OF ALL TRADERS AND SUPERVISORY
PERSONNEL IN THE OTC TRADING DEPTS. THEY WILL MAKE A 1 TIME
FILING WITH THE COMMITTEE BY THE 1/15/89 THAT IT HAS CONDUCTED A
THOROUGH REVIEW OF ALL PERSONNEL ASSOCIATED WITH OTC TRADING
TO ASSURE PROPER REGISTRATION STATUS.$25,000 FINED PAID 12/12/87

i
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

THE NASD'S COMPLAINT ALLEGED THAT BEAR, STEARNS VIOLATED THE
NASD RULES OF FAIR PRACTICE BY FAILING TO REPORT CERTAIN
TRANSACTIONS IN OTC SECURITIES TO THE NASD'S NATIONAL MARKET
SYSTEM (NMS). THE COMPLAINT FURTHER ALLEGED THAT BEAR,
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about
J.P. MORGAN
SECURITIES
LLC CERTAIN TRANSACTIONS TO THE NMS
STEARNS
FAILED
TO REPORT
SYSTEM WITHIN 90 SECONDS OF EXECUTION OF EACH TRADE AS

678

www.finra.org/brokercheck

User Guidance

THE NASD'S COMPLAINT ALLEGED THAT BEAR, STEARNS VIOLATED THE
NASD RULES OF FAIR PRACTICE BY FAILING TO REPORT CERTAIN
TRANSACTIONS IN OTC SECURITIES TO THE NASD'S NATIONAL MARKET
SYSTEM (NMS). THE COMPLAINT FURTHER ALLEGED THAT BEAR,
STEARNS FAILED TO REPORT CERTAIN TRANSACTIONS TO THE NMS
SYSTEM WITHIN 90 SECONDS OF EXECUTION OF EACH TRADE AS
REQUIRED BY NASD RULES AND THAT BEAR, STEARNS FAILED TO
PROPERLY REGISTER AT LEAST TWO PERSONS INVOLVED IN THE
MANAGEMENT AND SUPERVISION OF OTC TRADERS. FINALLY, THE
COMPLAINT ALLEGED THAT BEAR, STEARNS FAILED TO MAINTAIN
WRITTEN PROCEDURES ENABLING THE FIRM TO PROPERLY SUPERVISE
THE ACTIVITIES OF OTC TRADERS.
Initiated By:

NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF SECURITIES DEALERS, INC. ("NASD")

Date Initiated:

10/01/1988

Docket/Case Number:

UNKNOWN

Principal Product Type:

Equity - OTC

Other Product Type(s):
Principal Sanction(s)/Relief
Sought:

Censure

Other Sanction(s)/Relief
Sought:
Resolution:

Settled

Resolution Date:

10/14/1988

Sanctions Ordered:

Censure
Monetary/Fine $25,000.00

Other Sanctions Ordered:
Sanction Details:

ON OCTOBER 14, 1988, THE MARKET SURVEILLANCE COMMITTEE OF THE
NASD ACCEPTED AN OFFER OF SETTLEMENT SUBMITTED BY BEAR,
STEARNS & CO. INC. AS A CONDITION OF SETTLEMENT, THE FIRM WAS
CENSURED AND FINED $25,000 AND AGREED TO ADOPT AND ENFORCE
WRITTEN PROCEDURES REGARDING THE CONDUCT OF OTC TRADERS
WITH RESPECT TO THE REPORTING OF TRANSACTIONS TO THE NMS
SYSTEM. THE FIRM AGREED TO FILE WITH THE MARKET SURVEILLANCE
COMMITTEE ON A QUARTERLY BASIS REPORTS REFLECTING THE
RESULTS OF ITS INTERNAL COMPLIANCE WITH NASD REPORTING
REQUIREMENTS UNTIL BEAR, STEARNS' AUTOMATED TRADE REPORTING
SYSTEM IS OPERATIONAL. BEAR, STEARNS ALSO REPRESENTED TO THE
NASD THAT THE FIRM WOULD AUTOMATE ITS NMS TRADE REPORTING
SYSTEM IN EACH OF THE FIVE DEPARTMENTS MAKING MARKETS IN OTC
SECURITIES AND THAT IT WOULD FILE WITH THE MARKET SURVEILLANCE
COMMITTEE QUARTERLY REPORTS REFLECTING ITS PROGRESS AND THE
IMPLEMENTATION OF THE AUTOMATED SYSTEM. THESE REPORTS ALSO
WILLJ.P.
CONTINUE
UNTIL THE
©2019 FINRA. All rights reserved. Report about
MORGAN SECURITIES
LLCSYSTEM IS OPERATIONAL. FINALLY, THE FIRM
AGREED TO ADOPT WRITTEN PROCEDURES TO INSURE THE FULL AND

679

www.finra.org/brokercheck

SYSTEM IS OPERATIONAL. BEAR, STEARNS ALSO REPRESENTED TO THE
NASD THAT THE FIRM WOULD AUTOMATE ITS NMS TRADE REPORTING
SYSTEM IN EACH OF THE FIVE DEPARTMENTS MAKING MARKETS IN OTC
SECURITIES AND THAT IT WOULD FILE WITH THE MARKET SURVEILLANCE
COMMITTEE QUARTERLY REPORTS REFLECTING ITS PROGRESS AND THE
IMPLEMENTATION OF THE AUTOMATED SYSTEM. THESE REPORTS ALSO
WILL CONTINUE UNTIL THE SYSTEM IS OPERATIONAL. FINALLY, THE FIRM
AGREED TO ADOPT WRITTEN PROCEDURES TO INSURE THE FULL AND
COMPLETE REGISTRATION OF ALL TRADERS AND SUPERVISORY
PERSONNEL IN THE OTC TRADING DEPARTMENTS AND REPRESENTED
THAT THE REGISTRATION DEPARTMENT WILL CONDUCT PERIODIC
REVIEWS OF THE OTC TRADING AREAS TO DETERMINE THAT INDIVIDUALS
IN THOSE DEPARTMENTS ARE PROPERLY REGISTERED.

MARKET SURVEILLANCE COMMITTEE COMPLAINT NO. CMS950047 AWC.

CO., INC. (BEST) ON MAY 4, 1995 IN WHICH BEST IS ALLEGED TO
HAVE VIOLATED RULE 11Ac1-1(c) OF THE SECURITIES EXCHANGE ACT OF
1934, PART V, SECTION 2(b) OF SCHEDULE D TO THE ASSOCIATION'S
BY-LAWS AND ARTICLE III, SECTIONS 1 AND 6 OF THE ASSOCIATION'S
RULES OF FAIR PRACTICE BY FAILING TO HONOR THE QUOTATIONS IT
CAUSED TO BE DISSEMINATED THROUGH THE NASDAQ SYSTEM (BACKING
AWAY).

$2,500. THE AWC BECAME FINAL ON SEPTEMBER 25, 1995.

Regulator Statement

+07/14/97+ CFTC PROCEEDINGS BULLETIN DATED DECEMBER 31, 1996,
PAGE 23, DISCLOSES; BEAR STEARNS & CO., INC. VIOLATED CFTC ACT
6(b) AND REGULATIONS 166.3 AND 1.35(a-1)(2). BEAR STEARNS &
CO., INC. WAS ISSUED A CEASE AND DESIST ORDER AND PENALIZED IN
THE AMOUNT OF $250,000. DOCKET/CASE NO. 92-5, DATED 11/19/91.

i
Reporting Source:

Firm

Current Status:

Final

Allegations:

THE CFTC FILED ITS COMPLAINT AGAINST BEAR, STEARNS & CO. INC. AND
STEPHEN JOHNSON ALLEGING THREE COUNTS OF VIOLATION OF THE
COMMODITY EXCHANGE ACT: (I) FAILURE TO PREPARE A WRITTEN
RECORD OF ORDERS INCLUDING THE ACCOUNT IDENTIFICATION FOR
ORDERS PLACED ON THE CHICAGO MERCANTILE EXCHANGE FROM THE
DALLAS BRANCH CATTLE DESK IN THE PERIOD JULY 1986 TO FEBRUARY
1988 (REGULATION 1.35 (A-1) (2); (II) FAILURE TO SUPERVISE THE DALLAS
BRANCH OFFICE CATTLE DESK AND THE CME FLOOR (REGULATION 166.3);
AND (III) VIOLATION OF JULY 25, 1986 CEASE AND DESIST INVOLVING
FAILURE TO SUPERVISE ORDER ENTRY PROCESS). (NOTE, REGULATION A
SHOULD BE LOWER CASE.)

693

www.finra.org/brokercheck
